name: IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHERS
description: Navy Breachers are elite Voidsmen who are outfitted, trained and endlessly drilled in boarding actions and void-based combat. Wielding a wide array of cutting gear, boarding shields and close-range weapons, they are well-suited to deadly combat in close confines.

selection.operatives: ↘ 1 IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER SERGEANT-AT-ARMS operative with the following option: ○ Navis shotgun and Navis hatchet Or one ○ option from each of the following: ○ Bolt pistol or heirloom autopistol ○ Chainsword or power weapon ↘ 10 IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER operatives selected from the following list: • ARMSMAN • AXEJACK • C.A.T. UNIT • ENDURANT • GHEISTSKULL • GRENADIER • GUNNER with Navis las-volley and gun butt • GUNNER with meltagun and gun butt • GUNNER with plasma gun and gun butt • HATCHCUTTER • SURVEYOR • VOID-JAMMER Other than ARMSMAN operatives, your kill team can only include each operative on this list once. Your kill team can only include up to two GUNNER operatives. Your kill team can only include a GHEISTSKULL operative if it also includes a VOID-JAMMER operative, and it can only include a C.A.T. UNIT operative if it also includes a SURVEYOR operative. These operatives count as half a selection each, meaning you can select both of them and it’s treated as one selection in total.

operatives.name: NAVIS SERGEANT-AT-ARMS
operatives.description: A Tempestor leads their kill team into the thick of battle. More than just a warrior, they also possess the tactical and strategic nous to direct their squad’s efforts. They exhibit a sense of agency and a flair for improvisation that can prove vital during extended operations behind enemy lines.
operatives.keywords: IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER, IMPERIUM, LEADER, SERGEANT-AT-ARMS

abilities.name: Command Breach
abilities.rules: Whenever you would use the Attack Order or Defence Order strategy ploy, if this operative is in the killzone, it costs you 0CP. Once during each of this operative’s activations, before or after it performs an action, if your Attack Order or Defence Order marker is in the killzone (see relevant strategy ploy), you can either: • Remove that marker and place it again. • Change the selected ploy to the other (e.g. your Attack Order becomes a Defence Order). You cannot do both, and you don’t need to spend any CP to change the ploy.

operatives.name: NAVIS ARMSMAN
operatives.description: Counted amongst the complement of many Navis Imperialis vessels, Navy Breachers are elite Voidsmen who are outfitted, trained and endlessly drilled in boarding actions and void-based combat.
operatives.keywords: IMPERIUM, ARMSMAN, IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER, REQUISITIONED OPERATIVES, NAVIS

abilities.name: Group Activation
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is expended, you must then activate one other ready friendly IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER ARMSMAN operative (if able) before your opponent activates. When that other operative is expended, your opponent then activates as normal (in other words, you cannot activate more than two operatives in succession with this rule). Ignore this rule when you are using the Breach and Clear faction rule.

operatives.name: NAVIS AXEJACK
operatives.description: Sometimes, the only solution to a problem faced by IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHERs is a heavy, two-handed axe. The AXEJACKs who carry these weapons can not only smash through blocked doorways obstacles, they are also formidable fighters who hack apart any enemy in their way.
operatives.keywords: IMPERIUM, AXEJACK, IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER, REQUISITIONED OPERATIVES, NAVIS

abilities.name: Emboldened
abilities.rules: Whenever an attack dice inflicts damage of 3 or more on this operative during a turning point in which it performed the Charge action, roll one D6: on a 5+, subtract 1 from that inflicted damage.

abilities.name: Wall Breacher
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative performs the Fight action against a terrain feature, if it has 1 wound remaining, Critical Dmg of 3 or more inflicts 1 less damage on it (to a minimum of 0).

operatives.name: NAVIS C.A.T. UNIT
operatives.description: Cyber-Altered Task Units are tracked reconnaissance vehicles that have served the Imperium for millennia. Fitted with pict-recording equipment and frequency scanning augurs, they can be remotely operated to provide vital tactical information for their kill team.
operatives.keywords: IMPERIUM, C.A.T. UNIT, REQUISITIONED OPERATIVES, IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER, NAVIS

abilities.name: Machine
abilities.rules: • This operative cannot be activated or perform actions if it’s within control range of an enemy operative, or if a friendly IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER SURVEYOR operative has been incapacitated. The turning point can end even if this operative is still ready. • This operative cannot perform any actions other than Charge, Dash, Fall Back, Reposition and Spot. • It cannot retaliate, assist in a fight, climb or jump. • Whenever determining control of a marker, treat this operative’s APL stat as 1 lower. Note this isn’t a change to its APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this. • Whenever this operative has a Conceal order and is in cover, it cannot be selected as a valid target, taking precedence over all other rules (e.g. Seek, Vantage terrain). • Whenever determining what’s visible to this operative, draw the line from any part of the miniature.

abilities.name: Expendable
abilities.rules: This operative is ignored for your opponent’s kill/elimination op (when it’s incapacitated, and when determining your starting number of operatives). It’s also ignored for victory conditions and scoring VPs if either require operatives to ‘escape’, ‘survive’ or be incapacitated by enemy operatives (if it escapes/survives/is incapacitated, determining how many operatives must escape/survive/be incapacitated, etc.).

actions.name: Spot
effects: ▶ Select one enemy operative visible to this operative. Until the end of the turning point, until that enemy operative is no longer visible to this operative or until this operative performs this action again (whichever comes first), whenever a friendly IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER operative is shooting that enemy operative, you can use this effect. If you do: • That friendly operative’s ranged weapons have the Seek Light weapon rule. • That enemy operative cannot be obscured.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

operatives.name: NAVIS ENDURANT
operatives.description: ENDURANTs are the most heavily armoured and resilient operatives in an IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER kill team. They can weather devastating fusillades of fire and deflect blows that would pulverise lesser beings. With their heavy, void-sealed armour, they are ideal for leading assaults into hostile territory.
operatives.keywords: IMPERIUM, ENDURANT, IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER, REQUISITIONED OPERATIVES, NAVIS

abilities.name: Breachwall
abilities.rules: Whenever your opponent is selecting a valid target, they cannot select another friendly IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER operative whose base is touching this operative’s if this operative has an Engage order and is intervening. This rule has no effect if more than one other friendly operative’s base is touching this operative’s.

abilities.name: Disengage
abilities.rules: This operative can perform the Fall Back action for 1 less AP.

operatives.name: NAVIS GHEISTSKULL
operatives.description: These servo-skulls are often made from the heads of former IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHERs. As a result, they are often named ‘Dead Man’s Revenge’ or regarded as the perished soldier’s ‘Last Laugh’ for their ability to detonate and kill all around them in a final act of defiance towards the enemy.
operatives.keywords: IMPERIUM, GHEISTSKULL, NAVIS, REQUISITIONED OPERATIVES, IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER

abilities.name: Expendable
abilities.rules: This operative is ignored for your opponent’s kill/elimination op (when it’s incapacitated, and when determining your starting number of operatives). It’s also ignored for victory conditions and scoring VPs if either require operatives to ‘escape’, ‘survive’ or be incapacitated by enemy operatives (if it escapes/survives/is incapacitated, determining how many operatives must escape/survive/be incapacitated, etc.).

abilities.name: Machine
abilities.rules: • This operative cannot perform any actions other than Boost, Charge, Dash, Fall Back and Reposition. • It cannot retaliate or assist in a fight. • Whenever determining control of a marker, treat this operative’s APL stat as 1 lower. Note this isn’t a change to its APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this. • Whenever this operative has a Conceal order and is in cover, it cannot be selected as a valid target, taking precedence over all other rules (e.g. Vantage terrain).

actions.name: Navis Gheistskull
effects: ▶ Until the end of the activation, add 6" to this operative’s Move stat.
conditions: This operative can only perform this action once per battle, and cannot perform it during the first turning point.

operatives.name: NAVIS GRENADIER
operatives.description: It is the life of an IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER to become very accustomed to explosions. Even more so for the GRENADIERs. These Armsmen carry demolition charges designed to crack through bulkheads and sealed doors, enabling their squadmates to keep moving and reach their objectives.
operatives.keywords: IMPERIUM, GRENADIER, IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER, REQUISITIONED OPERATIVES, NAVIS

weapons.name: DEMOLITION CHARGE
weapons.rules: Range 3", Blast 2", Heavy (Reposition only), Limited 1, Piercing 1, Saturate

abilities.name: Grenadier
abilities.rules: This operative can use frag, krak and stun grenades (see universal equipment). Doing so doesn’t count towards any Limited uses you have (i.e. if you also select those grenades from equipment for other operatives). Whenever this operative is using a frag or krak grenade, improve the Hit stat of that weapon by 1.

operatives.name: NAVIS GUNNER
operatives.description: The largest troops in the squad who don’t fulfil the role of ENDURANTs carry their squad’s heaviest ranged weapons. A las-volley unleashes Devastating salvoes, the searing heat of a meltagun shot burns through a reinforced bulkhead, and even heavily-armoured enemies cannot withstand a plasma gun.
operatives.keywords: IMPERIUM, GUNNER, REQUISITIONED OPERATIVES, IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER, NAVIS

operatives.name: NAVIS HATCHCUTTER
operatives.description: It is vital for IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHERs to be able to move through enemy ships quickly to reach their objectives. HATCHCUTTERs can not only cut through barricades with their chainfists and plasma torches, they can use the latter to seal shut paths the foe might otherwise use.
operatives.keywords: IMPERIUM, HATCHCUTTER, IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER, REQUISITIONED OPERATIVES, NAVIS

actions.name: Weld Shut
effects: ▶ Select a closed hatchway (e.g. Killzone: Gallowdark) within this operative’s control range. 1 additional AP must be spent for other operatives to perform the Operate Hatch action to open that hatchway. This effect ends when that hatchway is opened. Note this operative isn’t affected by this effect.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative, or if it isn’t within 1" of a closed hatchway.

actions.name: Breach Point
effects: ▶ Place one of your Breach markers within this operative’s control range as close as possible to a terrain feature within control range of it. Whenever an operative is within 1" of that marker, it treats parts of that terrain feature that are no more than 1" thick as Accessible terrain.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative, or if a terrain feature isn’t within its control range.

operatives.name: NAVIS SURVEYOR
operatives.description: Knowing what is around a corner can mean life or death for IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHERs. By using a C.A.T. UNIT, which is capable of navigating narrow tunnels and holes, a SURVEYOR can investigate and prepare their squad for what might be ahead.
operatives.keywords: IMPERIUM, SURVEYOR, REQUISITIONED OPERATIVES, IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER, NAVIS

actions.name: Wayfind
effects: ▶ SUPPORT. Select one other friendly IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER operative (excluding C.A.T. UNIT or GHEISTSKULL) visible to and within 6" of this operative, or visible to and within 6" of a friendly IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER C.A.T. UNIT operative. Until the end of that operative’s next activation, add 1 to its APL stat. For the purposes of the Comms Device universal equipment, the operative the distance is being determined from must control that marker.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

actions.name: Remote Control
effects: ▶ Select one friendly IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER C.A.T. UNIT operative. That operative can immediately perform one free action, but it cannot move more than 3" during that action.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative, or if a friendly IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER C.A.T. UNIT operative isn’t in the killzone.

operatives.name: NAVIS VOID-JAMMER
operatives.description: It falls to the VOID-JAMMERs in an IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER kill team to operate gheistskulls – servo-skullls fitted with an explosive device and an electro-magnetic pulse emitter. These devices can move quickly, fly through the air and navigate terrain far too dense for the Armsmen in order to reach the foe.
operatives.keywords: IMPERIUM, VOID-JAMMER, REQUISITIONED OPERATIVES, IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER, NAVIS

weapons.name: GHEISTSKULL DETONATOR
weapons.rules: Blast 1", Lethal 5+, Limited 1, Silent, Stun, Detonate•

actions.name: Interference Pulse
effects: ▶ Select one enemy operative visible to and within 8" of a friendly GHEISTSKULL operative. Roll one D6, adding 1 to the result if that enemy operative is a valid target for that friendly GHEISTSKULL operative: on a 3+, subtract 1 from that enemy operative’s APL stat until the end of its next activation.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative, or if a friendly GHEISTSKULL operative isn’t in the killzone.

strategy_ploys.name: VOID ARMOUR
strategy_ploys.description: The armour worn by Imperial Navy Armsmen is void-sealed, meaning that they can fight in environments devoid of gravity or atmosphere. Such armour also serves to protect them from explosive blasts and flaming torrents.
strategy_ploys.rules: Whenever an operative is shooting a friendly IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER operative, if the ranged weapon in that sequence has the Blast or Torrent weapon rule (excluding weapons that have a sweeping profile), you can re-roll one of your defence dice, or up to two of your defence dice if that friendly operative is a GRENADIER. Friendly IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER operatives aren’t affected by the x" Devastating x weapon rule (i.e. Devastating with a distance) unless they are the target during that sequence.

equipment.name: REBREATHERS
equipment.description: These masks recycle a supply of oxygen, allowing the bearer to survive for extended periods in poisonous atmospheres, underwater or in the vacuum of space.
equipment.rules: You can ignore any changes to the APL stats of friendly IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER operatives, and they aren’t affected by enemy operatives’ Shock weapon rule.

equipment.name: RAZOR WIRE
equipment.description: Spooled rapidly out and affixed to jutting posts, razor wire acts as an easily deployed barrier and a painful deterrent to enemy operatives seeking to attack along particular routes.
equipment.rules: Razor wire is Exposed and Obstructing terrain. Before the battle, you can set it up wholly within your territory, on the killzone floor and more than 2" from other equipment terrain features, access points and Accessible terrain.

equipment.name: EXPLOSIVE GRENADES
equipment.description: A variety of offensive grenades are employed by the forces of the 41st Millennium. These range from simple fragmentation grenades to plasma and gravitic concussion grenades, while even more exotic devices are used to crack open enemy armour.
equipment.rules: When you select this equipment, select two explosive grenades (2 frag, 2 krak, or 1 frag and 1 krak). Each selection is a ranged weapon your operatives can use, but your kill team can only use that weapon a total number of times during the battle equal to your selection.

equipment.name: MINES
equipment.description: The battlefields of the 41st Millennium are plagued by myriad types of mine, from simple frag charges to monofilament web-snares and microplasma charges. Ultimately, all serve a similar, horrible purpose.
equipment.rules: Before the battle, you can set up one of your Mines markers wholly within your territory and more than 2" from other markers, access points and Accessible terrain. The first time that marker is within an operative’s control range, remove that marker and inflict D3+3 damage on that operative.

rules.name: BREACH AND CLEAR
rules.description: Once per turning point, when a ready friendly IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER operative is activated, you can use this rule. If you do, select one other ready friendly IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER operative visible to and within 3" of that operative. When that first friendly operative is expended, you can activate that other friendly operative before your opponent activates. When that other operative is expended, your opponent then activates as normal.
rules.rules: Once per turning point, when a ready friendly IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER operative is activated, you can use this rule. If you do, select one other ready friendly IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER operative visible to and within 3" of that operative. When that first friendly operative is expended, you can activate that other friendly operative before your opponent activates. When that other operative is expended, your opponent then activates as normal.

name: INQUISITORIAL AGENTS
description: Few authorities in the Imperium have greater jurisdiction than the Inquisition. An Inquisitor can, on a whim, requisition forces from virtually any of the Imperium’s military branches.

selection.operatives: ↘ 1 INQUISITORIAL AGENTS INTERROGATOR operative ↘ 1 INQUISITORIAL AGENTS TOME-SKULL operative ↘ 5 INQUISITORIAL AGENTS operatives selected from the following list: • AUTOSAVANT • QUESTKEEPER • DEATH WORLD VETERAN • ENLIGHTENER • HEXORCIST • MYSTIC • PENAL LEGIONNAIRE • PISTOLIER • GUN SERVITOR with one of the following options: ○ Heavy bolter; servo claw ○ Multi-melta; servo claw ○ Plasma cannon; servo claw ↘ 5 INQUISITORIAL AGENTS operatives selected from the list above, or REQUISITIONED operatives from one group in the Inquisitorial Requisition faction rule (you cannot select REQUISITIONED operatives from different groups). Your kill team can only include each operative on this list once, unless you’re not including any REQUISITIONED operatives, in which case you can include up to two GUN SERVITOR operatives, but each one must have different options. Your kill team (including any REQUISITIONED operatives) cannot include more than one weapon with the **Piercing 2** weapon rule, and cannot include more than three weapons with the **Piercing** X (excluding Piercing Crits X) weapon rule combined.

operatives.name: INTERROGATOR
operatives.description: An Inquisitor is the ultimate authority, an individual whose power is second only to the Emperor. They bear the authority to bring planets to their knees, wipe out entire cults and command the might of the Imperium’s forces. Even a junior Interrogator is terrifying to behold, with their force of will alone able to crush all before them.
operatives.keywords: Inquisitorial Agent, Imperium, Inquisition, Leader, Interrogator

abilities.name: Inquisitorial Tomes
abilities.rules: **STRATEGIC GAMBIT** and/or when this operative is activated. Select one of the following INQUISITORIAL TOME rules for this operative to have, and one for a friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS TOME-SKULL operative to have (they can be the same, and ignore the rule you didn’t select for each operative): - **Denunciation**: Whenever a friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS operative is shooting against, fighting against or retaliating against an enemy operative within 2" of friendly operatives with this rule, add 1 to the Atk stat of that friendly operative’s weapons. - **Sanctification**: Whenever an enemy operative is shooting against, fighting against or retaliating against a friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS operative within 2" of friendly operatives with this rule, subtract 1 from the Atk stat of that enemy operative’s weapons.

operatives.name: TOME-SKULL
operatives.description: These familiars are specialised servo-skulls designed to secure and hold open a treasured volume. The books chosen by Interrogators for a Tome-skull to bear into the field are seeped in holy power and filled with arcane lore, sanctifying ground and renouncing daemonic spirits.
operatives.keywords: Inquisitorial Agent, Imperium, Inquisition, Tome-Skull, Operative

abilities.name: Consecrated Tome
abilities.rules: This operative can have an INQUISITORIAL TOME rule (see INTERROGATOR). Note it keeps that rule even if that friendly INTERROGATOR operative is removed from the killzone.

abilities.name: Expendable
abilities.rules: This operative is ignored for your opponent’s kill/elimination op (when it’s incapacitated, and when determining your starting number of operatives). It’s also ignored for victory conditions and scoring VPs if either require operatives to ‘escape’, ‘survive’ or be incapacitated by enemy operatives (if it escapes/survives/is incapacitated, determining how many operatives must escape/survive/be incapacitated, etc.).

abilities.name: Group Activation
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is expended, you must then activate a ready friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS INTERROGATOR operative (if able) before your opponent activates. The same is true in reverse (INTERROGATOR followed by TOME-SKULL). When that other operative is expended, your opponent then activates as normal.

abilities.name: Machine
abilities.rules:
- This operative cannot perform any actions other than **Charge**, **Dash**, **Fall Back** and **Reposition**.
- It cannot retaliate or assist in a fight.
Whenever determining control of a marker, treat this operative’s APL stat as 1 lower. Note this isn’t a change to its APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this.
- Whenever this operative has a **Conceal** order and is in cover, it cannot be selected as a valid target, taking precedence over all other rules (e.g. Seek, Vantage terrain) except being within 2".

operatives.name: AUTOSAVANT
operatives.description: Little remains of the original Human the Autosavant once was. Much of their form has been replaced with bionics dedicated to the recording of information. Whether in their base of operations or the heat of battle, they never cease their scribblings of every word and deed they witness.
operatives.keywords: Inquisitorial Agent, Imperium, Inquisition, Autosavant, Operative

abilities.name: Scrivener
abilities.rules: Each subsequent time your opponent uses each ploy during the battle (excluding Command Re-roll), you gain 1CP (to a maximum of 2CP per turning point).

abilities.name: Irrefutable Report
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative contests an objective marker or one of your mission markers, it always controls that marker. This takes precedence over all other rules

abilities.name: Lightly Armed
abilities.rules: This operative cannot use any weapons that aren’t on its datacard, or perform unique actions.

operatives.name: QUESTKEEPER
operatives.description: Questkeepers – known also as Knight-Errants, Penitents and many other names – are fanatical zealots dedicated to the Imperial Creed. With an intense hatred for foes of the Emperor, they execute sworn quests to slaughter heretics and traitors.
operatives.keywords: Inquisitorial Agent, Imperium, Inquisition, Questkeeper, Operative

abilities.name: Irrepressible Purpose
abilities.rules: If this operative is incapacitated while fighting or retaliating, you can strike the enemy operative in that sequence with one of your unresolved successes before it’s removed from the killzone.

abilities.name: Zealot
abilities.rules: Whenever an attack dice inflicts damage of 3 or more on this operative, roll one D6: on a 5+, subtract 1 from that inflicted damage.

operatives.name: DEATH WORLD VETERAN
operatives.description: Every Inquisitor knows that death worlds produce the toughest soldiers in the Imperium. Many go to great lengths to draft experienced death worlders, for these warriors’ fighting skills are vital for hunting down the heretic.
operatives.keywords: Inquisitorial Agent, Imperium, Inquisition, Death World Veteran, Operative

abilities.name: Hunter
abilities.rules: This operative can perform the **Charge** action while it has a **Conceal** order.

abilities.name: Weathered
abilities.rules: Once per turning point, when this operative is fighting or retaliating, in the Resolve Attack Dice step, you can ignore the damage inflicted on it from one normal success.

operatives.name: ENLIGHTENER
operatives.description: Known to some as Excruciators or Truth-Peelers, these sadistic individuals are highly valued by Inquisitors for their utter lack of mercy and uncanny skill in extracting valuable information, even from the most uncooperative of prisoners.
operatives.keywords: Inquisitorial Agent, Imperium, Inquisition, Enlightener, Operative

abilities.name: No Escape
abilities.rules: Whenever an enemy operative would perform the **Fall Back** action while within control range of this operative, you can use this rule. If you do, roll one D6, subtracting 1 from the result if that enemy operative has a higher Wounds stat than this operative, and adding 1 if that enemy operative is wounded: on a 4+, that enemy operative cannot perform that action during that activation/counteraction (the AP spent on it isn’t refunded).

abilities.name: Extract Information
abilities.rules: Whenever an enemy operative is incapacitated within this operative’s control range, you gain 1CP.

operatives.name: REQUISITIONED GUN SERVITOR
operatives.description: More machine than Human, Gun Servitors are commonplace across the Imperium, and lobotomised to the extent that they lack any kind of capacity for independent thought. Used to fulfil mundane and difficult tasks, they carry hefty loads often including heavy weapons.
operatives.keywords: Inquisitorial Agent, Imperium, Inquisition, Gun Servitor, Operative

abilities.name: Lobotomised
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is activated, if it’s visible to and within 3" of another friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS operative (excluding GUN SERVITOR) or vice versa, add 1 to this operative’s APL stat until the end of that activation.

operatives.name: MYSTIC
operatives.description: Using their empyric senses to ‘see’ hidden truths and the souls of those they hunt, Mystics engage in the most arcane of missions. They provide vital support to their team, scrying the future for dangers or creating shields of psychic energy.
operatives.keywords: Inquisitorial Agent, Imperium, Inquisition, Operative, Mystic

abilities.name: Icon Bearer
abilities.rules: Whenever determining control of a marker, treat this operative’s APL stat as 1 higher. Note this isn’t a change to its APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this.

abilities.name: Lightly Armed
abilities.rules: This operative cannot use any weapons that aren’t on its datacard.

actions.name: Scry
effects: ▶ **PSYCHIC**. Select one friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS operative within 6" of this operative, then select one of the following effects to last until the start of this operative’s next activation, until it’s incapacitated or until it performs this action again (whichever comes first): - **Guidance**: **PSYCHIC**. Whenever the selected operative is shooting, fighting or retaliating, in the Roll Attack Dice step, you can retain one of your fails as a normal success instead of discarding it, or retain one of your normal successes as a critical success instead. - **Protection**: **PSYCHIC**. Whenever an operative is shooting the selected operative, in the Roll Defence Dice step, you can retain one of your fails as a normal success instead of discarding it, or retain one of your normal successes as a critical success instead.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

operatives.name: HEXORCIST
operatives.description: Hexorcists are holy men and women that are often mistaken for priests by the uninitiated. They believe that the Imperial Faith will only be spread at the barrel of a gun, and are experienced enough in the galaxy’s many horrors to know they must fight tooth and nail for it.
operatives.keywords: Inquisitorial Agent, Imperium, Inquisition, Hexorcist, Operative

abilities.name: Hexorcise
abilities.rules: Whenever an enemy operative is visible to and within 6" of this operative, your opponent cannot re-roll their attack or defence dice for that operative.

actions.name: Chasten
effects: ▶ Select one enemy operative that's a valid target for this operative and within 6" of it, then select one additional rule (including a unique action) that enemy operative has on its datacard (excluding a weapon rule). Until the end of that enemy operative’s next activation, it’s treated as not having that additional rule.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

operatives.name: PENAL LEGIONNAIRE
operatives.description: There are few better sources of expendable fighters with unusual skills and a need for repentance than an Imperial Penal Legion. These hardened criminals are useful with a blade and have nothing left to lose – perfect for the kind of suicidal missions Inquisitorial Agents must face in the Emperor’s service.
operatives.keywords: Inquisitorial Agent, Imperium, Inquisition, Penal Legionnaire, Operative

abilities.name: Chem-mask
abilities.rules: You can ignore any changes to this operative’s APL stat, and any changes to its stats from being injured. This operative isn’t affected by enemy operatives’ **Shock** and **Stun** weapon rules.

abilities.name: Cruel
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is shooting against, fighting against or retaliating against a wounded enemy operative, this operative’s weapons have the **Relentless** weapon rule.

operatives.name: PISTOLIER
operatives.description: Sometimes known as Desperadoes, these Agents are skilled killers who have honed their talents in the crime-ridden underbowels of hive worlds. Alongside the quick draw they have learned the value of the silent kill, as well as the ostentatiously explosive.
operatives.keywords: Inquisitorial Agent, Imperium, Inquisition, Pistolier, Operative

abilities.name: Pistolier
abilities.rules: You can ignore any changes to the Hit stat of this operative’s ranged weapons.

actions.name: Pistol Barrage
effects: ▶ Perform two free **Shoot** actions with this operative (this takes precedence over action restrictions). You must select a profile of its scoped plasma pistol for one action and its suppressed autopistol for the other (in any order).
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while it has a **Conceal** order, or during an activation in which it performed the **Shoot** action (or vice versa).

operatives.name: SISTER OF SILENCE VIGILATOR
operatives.keywords: Inquisitorial Agent, Imperium, Anathema Psykana, Sister of Silence, Requisitioned Operatives, Vigilator

operatives.name: SISTER OF SILENCE PROSECUTOR
operatives.keywords: Inquisitorial Agent, Imperium, Anathema Psykana, Sister of Silence, Prosecutor, Requisitioned Operatives

operatives.name: SISTER OF SILENCE WITCHSEEKER
operatives.keywords: Inquisitorial Agent, Imperium, Anathema Psykana, Sister of Silence, Requisitioned Operatives, Witchseeker

operatives.name: TEMPESTUS SCION VOX-OPERATOR
operatives.keywords: Inquisitorial Agent, Imperium, Astra Militarum, Tempestus Scion, Vox-Operator, Requisitioned Operatives

actions.name: Signal
effects: ▶ **SUPPORT**. Select one other friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS operative in the killzone. Until the end of that operative’s next activation, add 1 to its APL stat.
conditions: This operative can perform this action twice during its activation, but cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

operatives.name: TEMPESTUS SCION GUNNER
operatives.keywords: Inquisitorial Agent, Imperium, Astra Militarum, Tempestus Scion, Requisitioned Operatives, Gunner

abilities.name: Adaptive Equipment
abilities.rules: You can do each of the following once per turning point: - One friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS TEMPESTUS SCION TROOPER operative can perform the Smoke Grenade action. - One friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS TEMPESTUS SCION TROOPER operative can perform the Stun Grenade action. The rules for these actions are found in universal equipment. Performing these actions using this rule doesn’t count towards their action limits (i.e. if you also select those grenades from equipment).

operatives.name: TEMPESTUS SCION MEDIC
operatives.keywords: Inquisitorial Agent, Imperium, Astra Militarum, Tempestus Scion, Requisitioned Operatives, Medic

abilities.name: Medic!
abilities.rules: The first time during each turning point that another friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS operative would be incapacitated while visible to and within 3" of this operative, you can use this rule, providing neither this nor that operative is within control range of an enemy operative. If you do, that friendly operative isn’t incapacitated and has 1 wound remaining and cannot be incapacitated for the remainder of the action. After that action, that friendly operative can immediately perform a free **Dash** action, but must end that move within this operative’s control range. Subtract 1 from this and that operative’s APL stats until the end of their next activations respectively, and if this rule was used during that friendly operative’s activation, that activation ends. You cannot use this rule if this operative is incapacitated, or if it's a **Shoot** action and this operative would be a primary or secondary target.

actions.name: Medikit
effects: ▶ Select one friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS operative within this operative’s control range to regain up to 2D3 lost wounds. It cannot be an operative that the Medic! rule was used on during this turning point.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

operatives.name: TEMPESTUS SCION TROOPER
operatives.keywords: Inquisitorial Agent, Imperium, Astra Militarum, Tempestus Scion, Requisitioned Operatives, Trooper

abilities.name: Adaptive Equipment
abilities.rules: You can do each of the following once per turning point: - One friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS TEMPESTUS SCION TROOPER operative can perform the Smoke Grenade action. - One friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS TEMPESTUS SCION TROOPER operative can perform the Stun Grenade action. The rules for these actions are found in universal equipment. Performing these actions using this rule doesn’t count towards their action limits (i.e. if you also select those grenades from equipment).

operatives.name: NAVIS ARMSMAN
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Armsman, Inquisitorial Agent, Requisitioned Operatives, Navis

abilities.name: Group Activation
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is expended, you must then activate one other ready friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS BREACHER ARMSMAN operative (if able) before your opponent activates. When that other operative is expended, your opponent then activates as normal (in other words, you cannot activate more than two operatives in succession with this rule). Ignore this rule when you are using the Breach and Clear faction rule.

operatives.name: NAVIS AXEJACK
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Axejack, Inquisitorial Agent, Requisitioned Operatives, Navis

abilities.name: Emboldened
abilities.rules: Whenever an attack dice inflicts damage of 3 or more on this operative during a turning point in which it performed the **Charge** action, roll one D6: on a 5+, subtract 1 from that inflicted damage.

operatives.name: NAVIS C.A.T. UNIT
operatives.keywords: Imperium, C.A.T. Unit, Requisitioned Operatives, Inquisitorial Agent, Navis

abilities.name: Machine
abilities.rules: - This operative cannot be activated or perform actions if it’s within control range of an enemy operative, or if a friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS SURVEYOR operative has been incapacitated. The turning point can end even if this operative is still ready. - This operative cannot perform any actions other than **Charge**, **Dash**, **Fall Back**, **Reposition** and **Spot**. - It cannot retaliate, assist in a fight, climb or jump. - Whenever determining control of a marker, treat this operative’s APL stat as 1 lower. Note this isn’t a change to its APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this. - Whenever this operative has a **Conceal** order and is in cover, it cannot be selected as a valid target, taking precedence over all other rules (e.g. Vantage terrain). - Whenever determining what’s visible to this operative, draw the line from any part of the miniature.

abilities.name: Expendable
abilities.rules: This operative is ignored for your opponent’s kill/elimination op (when it’s incapacitated, and when determining your starting number of operatives). It’s also ignored for victory conditions and scoring VPs if either require operatives to ‘escape’, ‘survive’ or be incapacitated by enemy operatives (if it escapes/survives/is incapacitated, determining how many operatives must escape/survive/be incapacitated, etc.).

actions.name: Spot
effects: ▶ Select one enemy operative visible to this operative. Until the end of the turning point, until that enemy operative is no longer visible to this operative or until this operative performs this action again (whichever comes first), whenever a friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS BREACHER operative is shooting that enemy operative, you can use this effect. If you do: - That friendly operative’s ranged weapons have the **Seek Light** weapon rule. - That enemy operative cannot be obscured.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

operatives.name: NAVIS ENDURANT
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Endurant, Inquisitorial Agent, Requisitioned Operatives, Navis

abilities.name: Breachwall
abilities.rules: Whenever your opponent is selecting a valid target, they cannot select another friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS operative whose base is touching this operative’s if this operative has an Engage order and is intervening. This rule has no effect if more than one other friendly operative’s base is touching this operative’s.

abilities.name: Disengage
abilities.rules: This operative can perform the **Fall Back** action for 1 less AP.

operatives.name: NAVIS GHEISTSKULL
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Gheistskull, Navis, Requisitioned Operatives, Inquisitorial Agent

abilities.name: Expendable
abilities.rules: This operative is ignored for your opponent’s kill/elimination op (when it’s incapacitated, and when determining your starting number of operatives). It’s also ignored for victory conditions and scoring VPs if either require operatives to ‘escape’, ‘survive’ or be incapacitated by enemy operatives (if it escapes/survives/is incapacitated, determining how many operatives must escape/survive/be incapacitated, etc.).

abilities.name: Machine
abilities.rules:
- This operative cannot perform any actions other than **Boost**, **Charge**, **Dash**, **Fall Back** and **Reposition**.
- It cannot retaliate or assist in a fight.
- Whenever determining control of a marker, treat this operative’s APL stat as 1 lower. Note this isn’t a change to its APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this.
- Whenever this operative has a **Conceal** order and is in cover, it cannot be selected as a valid target, taking precedence over all other rules (e.g. Vantage terrain).

actions.name: Navis Gheistskull
effects: ▶ Until the end of the activation, add 6" to this operative’s Move stat.
conditions: This operative can only perform this action once per battle, and cannot perform it during the first turning point.

operatives.name: NAVIS GRENADIER
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Grenadier, Inquisitorial Agent, Requisitioned Operatives, Navis

abilities.name: Grenadier
abilities.rules: This operative can use frag, krak and stun grenades (see universal equipment). Doing so doesn’t count towards any **Limited** uses you have (i.e. if you also select those grenades from equipment for other operatives). Whenever this operative is using a frag or krak grenade, improve the Hit stat of that weapon by 1.

operatives.name: NAVIS GUNNER
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Gunner, Requisitioned Operatives, Inquisitorial Agent, Navis

operatives.name: NAVIS HATCHCUTTER
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Hatchcutter, Inquisitorial Agent, Requisitioned Operatives, Navis

actions.name: Weld Shut
effects: ▶ Select a closed hatchway (e.g. Killzone: Gallowdark) within this operative’s control range. 1 additional AP must be spent for other operatives to perform the **Operate Hatch** action to open that hatchway. This effect ends when that hatchway is opened. Note this operative isn’t affected by this effect.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative, or if it isn’t within 1" of a closed hatchway.

actions.name: Breach Point
effects: ▶ Place one of your Breach markers within this operative’s control range as close as possible to a terrain feature within control range of it. Whenever an operative is within 1" of that marker, it treats parts of that terrain feature that are no more than 1" thick as Accessible terrain.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative, or if a terrain feature isn’t within its control range.

operatives.name: NAVIS SURVEYOR
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Surveyor, Requisitioned Operatives, Inquisitorial Agent, Navis

actions.name: Wayfind
effects: ▶ **SUPPORT**. Select one other friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS operative (excluding **C.A.T. UNIT** or **GHEISTSKULL**) visible to and within 6" of this operative, or visible to and within 6" of a friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS **C.A.T. UNIT** operative. Until the end of that operative’s next activation, add 1 to its APL stat. For the purposes of the Comms Device universal equipment, the operative the distance is being determined from must control that marker.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

actions.name: Remote Control
effects: ▶ Select one friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS **C.A.T. UNIT** operative. That operative can immediately perform one free action, but it cannot move more than 3" during that action.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative, or if a friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS **C.A.T. UNIT** operative isn’t in the killzone.

operatives.name: NAVIS VOID-JAMMER
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Void-Jammer, Requisitioned Operatives, Inquisitorial Agent, Navis

actions.name: Interference Pulse
effects: ▶ Select one enemy operative visible to and within 8" of a friendly GHEISTSKULL operative. Roll one D6, adding 1 to the result if that enemy operative is a valid target for that friendly GHEISTSKULL operative: on a 3+, subtract 1 from that enemy operative’s APL stat until the end of its next activation.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative, or if a friendly GHEISTSKULL operative isn’t in the killzone.

operatives.name: KASRKIN COMBAT MEDIC
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Astra Militarum, Medic, Combat Medic, Requisitioned Operatives, Inquisitorial Agent, Kasrkin

abilities.name: Medic!
abilities.rules: The first time during each turning point that another friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS operative would be incapacitated while visible to and within 3" of this operative, you can use this rule, providing neither this nor that operative is within control range of an enemy operative. If you do, that friendly operative isn’t incapacitated and has 1 wound remaining and cannot be incapacitated for the remainder of the action. After that action, that friendly operative can immediately perform a free **Dash** action, but must end that move within this operative’s control range. Subtract 1 from this and that operative’s APL stats until the end of their next activations respectively, and if this rule was used during that friendly operative’s activation, that activation ends. You cannot use this rule if this operative is incapacitated, or if it's a **Shoot** action and this operative would be a primary or secondary target.

actions.name: Medikit
effects: ▶ Select one friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS operative within this operative’s control range to regain up to 2D3 lost wounds. It cannot be an operative that the Medic! rule was used on during this turning point.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

operatives.name: KASRKIN DEMO-TROOPER
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Astra Militarum, Demo-Trooper, Requisitioned Operatives, Inquisitorial Agent, Kasrkin

abilities.name: Melta Mine
abilities.rules: This operative is carrying your Melta Mine marker. It can perform the **Pick Up Marker** action on that marker, and whenever it performs the **Place Marker** action on that marker, it can immediately perform a free **Dash** action. That marker cannot be placed within an enemy operative’s control range (if this operative is incapacitated while carrying that marker and that marker cannot be placed, it’s removed with this operative).

abilities.name: Proximity Mine
abilities.rules: The first time your Melta Mine marker is within another operative’s control range, remove that marker and inflict 2D6+3 damage on that operative; if it isn’t incapacitated, end its action (if any), even if that action’s effects aren’t fulfilled. If it cannot be placed, move it the minimum amount to do so. Note that this operative is ignored for these effects (i.e. it cannot set it off or take damage from that marker).

abilities.name: Blast Padding
abilities.rules: Whenever an operative is shooting this operative with a weapon that has the **Blast** or **Torrent** weapon rule (excluding weapons that have a sweeping profile), you can re-roll one of your defence dice. In addition, this operative isn’t affected by the x" **Devastating** x weapon rule (i.e. **Devastating** with a distance) unless they are the target during that sequence.

operatives.name: KASRKIN RECON-TROOPER
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Astra Militarum, Recon-Trooper, Requisitioned Operatives, Inquisitorial Agent, Kasrkin

abilities.name: Reconnoitre Killzone
abilities.rules: The Relocate strategy ploy costs you 0CP if this operative is the selected friendly KASRKIN operative. If this operative is in an INQUISITORIAL AGENTS kill team, you can still use this rule (replace KASRKIN on that ploy with INQUISITORIAL AGENTS ). This takes precedence over the restriction in the Inquisitorial Requisition rule, and you cannot use that ploy with an INQUISITORIAL AGENTS kill team unless this operative is selected.

actions.name: Auspex Scan
effects: ▶ Until the start of this operative’s next activation or until it’s incapacitated (whichever comes first), whenever an enemy operative within 8" of this operative, that enemy operative is being scanned. When a friendly KASRKIN operative is shooting an enemy operative that's being scanned, that enemy operative cannot be obscured.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

operatives.name: KASRKIN SHARPSHOOTER
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Astra Militarum, Sharpshooter, Gunner or Sharpshooter, Inquisitorial Agent, Kasrkin, Requisitioned Operatives

abilities.name: Camo Cloak
abilities.rules:
Whenever an operative is shooting this operative:
- Ignore the **Saturate** weapon rule.
- If you can retain any cover saves, you can retain one additional cover save, or you can retain one cover save as a critical success instead. This isn’t cumulative with improved cover saves from Vantage terrain.

actions.name: Auspex Scan
effects: ▶ Until the start of this operative’s next activation or until it’s incapacitated (whichever comes first), whenever a friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS operative is shooting an enemy operative within 8" of this operative, that enemy operative cannot be obscured.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

operatives.name: KASRKIN TROOPER
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Astra Militarum, Trooper, Requisitioned Operatives, Kasrkin, Inquisitorial Agent

abilities.name: Adaptive Equipment
abilities.rules: You can do each of the following once per turning point: - One friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS TROOPER operative can perform the Smoke Grenade action. - One friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS TROOPER operative can perform the Stun Grenade action. The rules for these actions are found in universal equipment. Performing these actions using this rule doesn’t count towards their action limits (i.e. if you also select those grenades from equipment).

operatives.name: KASRKIN VOX-TROOPER
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Astra Militarum, Vox-Trooper, Requisitioned Operatives, Kasrkin, Inquisitorial Agent

actions.name: Battle Comms
effects: ▶ Select one other friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS operative. Until the end of that operative’s next activation, add 1 to its APL stat (to a maximum of 3 after all APL stat changes have been totalled).
conditions: This operative can perform this action twice during its activation, but cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative

operatives.name: KASRKIN GUNNER
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Astra Militarum, Gunner, Gunner or Sharpshooter, Requisitioned Operatives, Kasrkin, Inquisitorial Agent

operatives.name: DEATH KORPS BRUISER
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Astra Militarum, Bruiser, Death Korps, Requisitioned Operatives, Inquisitorial Agent

abilities.name: Bruiser
abilities.rules: Once per turning point, when this operative is fighting or retaliating, in the Resolve Attack Dice step, you can ignore the damage inflicted on it from one normal success.

operatives.name: DEATH KORPS CONFIDANT
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Astra Militarum, Confidant, Requisitioned Operatives, Inquisitorial Agent, Death Korps

abilities.name: Second in Command
abilities.rules: If a friendly **WATCHMASTER** operative is incapacitated and removed from the killzone, you can use this rule. If you do, until the end of the battle, this operative can issue a **GUARDSMAN ORDER** as a **STRATEGIC GAMBIT** (even though it’s not a **WATCHMASTER** operative).

abilities.name: Directive
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is activated, if you haven’t used the Second in Command rule during the battle, you can select one other ready friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS operative visible to and within 6" of it. When this operative is expended, activate that other friendly operative before your opponent activates (if that operative is a **TROOPER**, ignore its Group Activation rule).

operatives.name: DEATH KORPS GUNNER
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Astra Militarum, Gunner, Death Korps, Inquisitorial Agent, Requisitioned Operatives

operatives.name: DEATH KORPS MEDIC
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Astra Militarum, Medic, Requisitioned Operatives, Inquisitorial Agent, Death Korps

abilities.name: Medic!

If you do, that friendly operative isn’t incapacitated and has 1 wound remaining and cannot be incapacitated for the remainder of the action. After that action, that friendly operative can immediately perform a free **Dash** action, but must end that move within this operative’s control range. Subtract 1 from this and that operative’s APL stats until the end of their next activations respectively, and if this rule was used during that friendly operative’s activation, that activation ends. You cannot use this rule if this operative is incapacitated, or if it's a **Shoot** action and this operative would be a primary or secondary target.

actions.name: Death Korps Medic
effects: ▶ Select one friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS operative within this operative’s control range to regain up to 2D3 lost wounds. It cannot be an operative that the Medic! rule was used on during this turning point.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

operatives.name: DEATH KORPS SNIPER
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Astra Militarum, Sniper, Requisitioned Operatives, Inquisitorial Agent, Death Korps

operatives.name: DEATH KORPS SAPPER
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Astra Militarum, Sapper, Requisitioned Operatives, Inquisitorial Agent, Death Korps

abilities.name: Mine Layer
abilities.rules: This operative is carrying your Mine marker. It can perform the **Pick Up Marker** action on that marker, and whenever it performs the **Place Marker** action on that marker, it can immediately perform a free **Dash** action.

operatives.name: DEATH KORPS TROOPER
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Astra Militarum, Trooper, Death Korps, Inquisitorial Agent, Requisitioned Operatives

abilities.name: Group Activation
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is expended, you must then activate one other ready friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS **TROOPER** operative (if able) before your opponent activates. When that other operative is expended, your opponent then activates as normal (in other words, you cannot activate more than two operatives in succession with this rule).

operatives.name: DEATH KORPS VETERAN
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Astra Militarum, Veteran, Requisitioned Operatives, Death Korps, Inquisitorial Agent

abilities.name: Veteran Guardsman
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is activated, it can receive one **GUARDSMAN ORDER**.

abilities.name: Bionics
abilities.rules: Normal Dmg of 3 or more inflicts 1 less damage on this operative.

operatives.name: DEATH KORPS VOX-OPERATOR
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Astra Militarum, Vox-Operator, Requisitioned Operatives, Death Korps, Inquisitorial Agent

abilities.name: Relay Orders
abilities.rules: Once per turning point, when this operative receives a **GUARDSMAN ORDER**, if it’s not within control range of enemy operatives, it can relay that order. Whenever an order is relayed, all friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS operatives in the killzone receive that order, then subtract 1 from this operative’s APL stat until the end of its next activation.

actions.name: Signal
effects: ▶ **SUPPORT**. Select one other friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS operative visible to and within 6" of this operative. Until the end of that operative’s next activation, add 1 to its APL stat.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

operatives.name: DEATH KORPS ZEALOT
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Astra Militarum, Zealot, Requisitioned Operatives, Death Korps, Inquisitorial Agent

abilities.name: The Emperor Protects
abilities.rules: Whenever an operative is shooting this operative, you can re-roll any of your defence dice.

operatives.name: ARBITES CASTIGATOR
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Adeptus Arbites, Castigator, Requisitioned Operatives, Exaction, Inquisitorial Agent

abilities.name: Engendered Focus
abilities.rules: You can ignore any changes to this operative’s stats (including its weapons’ stats, but excluding its Save stat).

abilities.name: Zealous Dedication
abilities.rules: Whenever an attack dice inflicts damage of 3 or more on this operative, roll one D6: on a 5+, subtract 1 from that inflicted damage.

abilities.name: Castigator's Arrest
abilities.rules: Whenever an enemy operative is within control range of this operative, if no other enemy operatives are within this operative’s control range, that enemy operative cannot perform the **Fall Back** action.

operatives.name: ARBITES CHIRURGANT
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Adeptus Arbites, Chirurgant, Medic, Requisitioned Operatives, Inquisitorial Agent, Exaction

abilities.name: Medic!
abilities.rules: The first time during each turning point that another friendly **EXACTION SQUAD** operative would be incapacitated while visible to and within 3" of this operative, you can use this rule, providing neither this nor that operative is within control range of an enemy operative. If you do, that friendly operative isn’t incapacitated and has 1 wound remaining and cannot be incapacitated for the remainder of the action. After that action, that friendly operative can immediately perform a free **Dash** action, but must end that move within this operative’s control range. Subtract 1 from this and that operative’s APL stats until the end of their next activations respectively, and if this rule was used during that friendly operative’s activation, that activation ends. You cannot use this rule if this operative is incapacitated, or if it's a **Shoot** action and this operative would be a primary or secondary target.

actions.name: Medikit
effects: ▶ Select one friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS operative within this operative’s control range to regain up to 2D3 lost wounds. It cannot be an operative that the Medic! rule was used on during this turning point.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

operatives.name: ARBITES GUNNER
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Adeptus Arbites, Gunner, Requisitioned Operatives, Inquisitorial Agent, Exaction

operatives.name: ARBITES LEASHMASTER
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Adeptus Arbites, Leashmaster, Requisitioned Operatives, Exaction, Inquisitorial Agent

abilities.name: Handler
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is activated, you can activate a ready friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS **R-VR CYBER-MASTIFF** operative at the same time. Complete their activations action by action in any order.

actions.name: R-VR Command
effects: ▶ Select one friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS **R-VR CYBER-MASTIFF** operative and change its attack pattern.

operatives.name: ARBITES MALOCATOR
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Adeptus Arbites, Malocator, Requisitioned Operatives, Exaction, Inquisitorial Agent

abilities.name: Acute Focus
abilities.rules: Once during each of this operative’s activations, it can perform the **Pick Up Marker**, **Place Marker**, **Veriscant** or a mission action for 1 less AP.

operatives.name: ARBITES MARKSMAN
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Adeptus Arbites, Marksman, Requisitioned Operatives, Exaction, Inquisitorial Agent

operatives.name: ARBITES REVELATUM
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Adeptus Arbites, Revelatum, Requisitioned Operatives, Exaction, Inquisitorial Agent

abilities.name: First in the Field
abilities.rules: **STRATEGIC GAMBIT** in the first turning point. If this operative is wholly within your drop zone, it can immediately perform a free **Reposition** action.

operatives.name: ARBITES SUBDUCTOR
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Adeptus Arbites, Subductor, Requisitioned Operatives, Inquisitorial Agent, Exaction

abilities.name: Stubborn Subjugator
abilities.rules: You can ignore any changes to the Hit stat of this operative’s melee weapons.

operatives.name: R-VR CYBER-MASTIFF
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Adeptus Arbites, R-VR Cyber-Mastiff, Requisitioned Operatives, Inquisitorial Agent, Exaction

abilities.name: Beast
abilities.rules: This operative cannot perform any actions other than **Apprehend**, **Charge**, **Dash**, **Fall Back**, **Fight**, **Guard**, **Reposition**, **Pick Up Marker** and **Place Marker**. It cannot use any weapons that aren’t on its datacard.

actions.name: Apprehend
effects: ▶ Select one enemy operative within this operative’s control range. Until that enemy operative is no longer within this operative’s control range, or until this operative performs this action again (whichever comes first), worsen the Hit stat of that enemy operative’s weapons by 1 (this isn’t cumulative with being injured); in addition, that enemy operative cannot perform the **Fall Back** action.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action unless an enemy operative is within its control range.

operatives.name: ARBITES VIGILANT
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Adeptus Arbites, Vigilant, Requisitioned Operatives, Exaction, Inquisitorial Agent

abilities.name: Close Quarters Vigilance
abilities.rules: This operative can perform the **Shoot** action (excluding **Guard**) while within control range of an enemy operative, but only if it hasn’t performed the **Charge** action during the activation, or if it’s a counteraction. Note this operative isn’t restricted from performing the **Charge** action after performing the **Shoot** action.

operatives.name: ARBITES VOX-SIGNIFIER
operatives.keywords: Imperium, Adeptus Arbites, Vox-Signifier, Requisitioned Operatives, Exaction, Inquisitorial Agent

actions.name: Signal
effects: ▶ **SUPPORT**. Select one other friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS operative visible to this operative. Until the end of that operative’s next activation, add 1 to its APL stat.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

strategy_ploys.name: DENOUNCE
strategy_ploys.description: None escape the long arm of the Inquisition. Those denounced and proclaimed guilty quail before its vengeful Agents.
strategy_ploys.rules: Select one enemy operative and roll one D3. In the Firefight phase of this turning point, that enemy operative cannot be activated or perform actions until it's the last enemy operative to be activated, or your opponent has activated a number of enemy operatives equal to the result of the D3 (whichever comes first). This ploy costs you 1 additional CP for each previous time you’ve used it during the battle (e.g. 1CP the first time you would use it, 2CP the second time, etc.).

equipment.name: ARMOURED BODYSUITS
equipment.rules: Whenever an operative is shooting a friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS operative (excluding TOME-SKULL) that has a 5+ Save stat, you can retain one of your defence dice results of 4 as a normal success.

equipment.name: COMBAT DAGGERS
equipment.rules: Friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS operatives have the following melee weapon. Whenever a friendly SISTER OF SILENCE operative is using it, add 1 to its Atk stat.

equipment.name: INQUISTORIAL ROSETTE
equipment.rules: Once per battle, when a friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS operative is activated, if you’ve used the Quarry strategy ploy during this turning point, you can use this rule. If you do, you can select a new enemy operative to be your quarry until the end of the turning point.

equipment.name: SERVO-SKULL
equipment.rules: Once per battle, one friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS operative can perform a mission action for 1 less AP.

equipment.name: EXPLOSIVE GRENADES
equipment.description: A variety of offensive grenades are employed by the forces of the 41st Millennium. These range from simple fragmentation grenades to plasma and gravitic concussion grenades, while even more exotic devices are used to crack open enemy armour.
equipment.rules: When you select this equipment, select two explosive grenades (2 frag, 2 krak, or 1 frag and 1 krak). Each selection is a ranged weapon your operatives can use, but your kill team can only use that weapon a total number of times during the battle equal to your selection.

equipment.name: MINES
equipment.description: The battlefields of the 41st Millennium are plagued by myriad types of mine, from simple frag charges to monofilament web‑snares and microplasma charges. Ultimately, all serve a similar, horrible purpose.
equipment.rules: Before the battle, you can set up one of your Mines markers wholly within your territory and more than 2" from other markers, access points and Accessible terrain. The first time that marker is within an operative’s control range, remove that marker and inflict D3+3 damage on that operative.

rules.name: INQUISITORIAL REQUISITION
rules.description: REQUISITIONED operatives can be taken from one of the following groups to supplement an INQUISITORIAL AGENTS kill team, as specified in this kill team’s selection rules: - DEATH KORPS - EXACTION SQUAD - IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER - KASRKIN - SISTER OF SILENCE - TEMPESTUS SCION These operatives have their faction keyword replaced in all instances on their datacards with INQUISITORIAL AGENTS (unless they already have it). You cannot use ploys and equipment associated with a REQUISITIONED operative’s former faction keyword, and you cannot use a REQUISITIONED operative’s former faction rules unless specified on their team selection list (it only applies to those REQUISITIONED operatives). Note that with their new faction keyword, REQUISITIONED operatives can interact with the INQUISITORIAL AGENTS rules. For example, a REQUISITIONED VOX-OPERATOR operative from the DEATH KORPS group would have its DEATH KORPS keyword replaced in all instances on its datacard with INQUISITORIAL AGENTS . This allows you to select any other friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS operative for its Signal unique action. However, the Guardsman Orders faction rule isn’t permitted, so its Relay Orders additional rule would be ignored. It would now also be a valid operative for the INQUISITORIAL AGENTS MYSTIC operative’s Scry unique action.
rules.rules: REQUISITIONED operatives can be taken from one of the following groups to supplement an INQUISITORIAL AGENTS kill team, as specified in this kill team’s selection rules: - DEATH KORPS - EXACTION SQUAD - IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER - KASRKIN - SISTER OF SILENCE - TEMPESTUS SCION These operatives have their faction keyword replaced in all instances on their datacards with INQUISITORIAL AGENTS (unless they already have it). You cannot use ploys and equipment associated with a REQUISITIONED operative’s former faction keyword, and you cannot use a REQUISITIONED operative’s former faction rules unless specified on their Inquisitorial Requisition card (it only applies to those REQUISITIONED operatives). Note that with their new faction keyword, REQUISITIONED operatives can interact with the INQUISITORIAL AGENTS rules. For example, a REQUISITIONED VOX-OPERATOR operative from the DEATH KORPS group would have its DEATH KORPS keyword replaced in all instances on its datacard with INQUISITORIAL AGENTS . This allows you to select any other friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENTS operative for its Signal unique action. However, the Guardsman Orders faction rule isn’t permitted, so its Relay Orders additional rule would be ignored. It would now also be a valid operative for the INQUISITORIAL AGENTS MYSTIC operative’s Scry unique action.

name: KASRKIN
description: The Kasrkin go where they are needed. Battle-hardened, uncompromising and equipped with the best weapons available, these elites pursue their objectives with professionalism, hard-won experience and rigid determination.

selection.operatives: ↘ 1 KASRKIN SERGEANT operative with one of the following options: ○ Bolt pistol; power weapon ○ Hot-shot lasgun; gun butt ○ Hot-shot laspistol; power weapon ○ Plasma pistol; chainsword ↘ 9 KASRKIN operatives selected from the following list: • COMBAT MEDIC • DEMO-TROOPER • GUNNER with flamer and gun butt • GUNNER with grenade launcher and gun butt • GUNNER with hot-shot volley gun and gun butt • GUNNER with meltagun and gun butt • GUNNER with plasma gun and gun butt • RECON-TROOPER • SHARPSHOOTER • TROOPER • VOX-TROOPER Other than TROOPER operatives, your kill team can only include each operative on this list once. You cannot select more than four of these operatives combined. Some KASRKIN rules refer to a ‘hot-shot weapon’. This is a ranged weapon that includes ‘hot-shot’ in its name, e.g. hot-shot lasgun, all profiles of a hot-shot marksman rifle, etc.

operatives.name: SERGEANT
operatives.description: Kasrkin Sergeants are uncompromising leaders. They issue precise orders and lead from the front, their disciplined ferocity backed up by master-crafted weaponry and decades of hard-won experience.
operatives.keywords: Kasrkin, Imperium, Astra Militarum, Leader, Sergeant

weapons.name: TACTICAL COMMAND
weapons.rules: ↘ Select one friendly KASRKIN operative, then select one SKILL AT ARMS for that operative to have until the Ready step of the next Strategy phase. This can be in addition to any SKILL AT ARMS it already has, but they cannot be the same. ↘ Alternatively, instead of resolving the above effect, if your Clearance Sweep marker is in the killzone, you can remove it and place it again.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

operatives.name: COMBAT MEDIC
operatives.description: It falls to the Combat Medics in a Kasrkin kill team to patch up their comrades. Though they are equipped with an array of field medicae equipment, their most potent assets are their determination and hardened battle skills.
operatives.keywords: Kasrkin, Imperium, Astra Militarum, Medic, Combat Medic

abilities.name: Medic!
abilities.rules: The first time during each turning point that another friendly KASRKIN operative would be incapacitated while visible to and within 3" of this operative, you can use this rule, providing neither this nor that operative is within control range of an enemy operative. If you do, that friendly operative isn’t incapacitated and has 1 wound remaining and cannot be incapacitated for the remainder of the action. After that action, that friendly operative can then immediately perform a free Dash action, but must end that move within this operative’s control range. Subtract 1 from this and that operative’s APL stats until the end of their next activations respectively, and if this rule was used during that friendly operative’s activation, that activation ends. You cannot use this rule if this operative is incapacitated, or if it's a Shoot action and this operative would be a primary or secondary target.

actions.name: Medikit
effects: ↘ Select one friendly KASRKIN operative within this operative’s control range to regain up to 2D3 lost wounds. It cannot be an operative that the Medic! rule was used on during this turning point.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

operatives.name: DEMO-TROOPER
operatives.description: Demo-troopers are the demolition experts of a Kasrkin kill team. They carry an array of high explosives – from melta bombs to frag grenades – that can blow apart enemy emplacements and armoured vehicles alike.
operatives.keywords: Kasrkin, Imperium, Astra Militarum, Demo-Trooper, Operative

abilities.name: Melta Mine
abilities.rules: This operative is carrying your Melta Mine marker. It can perform the Pick Up Marker action on that marker, and whenever it performs the Place Marker action on that marker, it can immediately perform a free Dash action. That marker cannot be placed within an enemy operative’s control range (if this operative is incapacitated while carrying that marker and that marker cannot be placed, it’s removed with this operative).

abilities.name: Proximity Mine
abilities.rules: The first time your Melta Mine marker is within another operative’s control range, remove that marker and inflict 2D6+3 damage on that operative; if it isn’t incapacitated, end its action (if any), even if that action’s effects aren’t fulfilled. If it cannot be placed, move it the minimum amount to do so. Note that this operative is ignored for these effects (i.e. it cannot set it off or take damage from that marker.

abilities.name: Blast Padding*
abilities.rules: Whenever an operative is shooting this operative with a weapon that has the Blast or Torrent weapon rule (excluding weapons that have a sweeping profile), you can re-roll one of your defence dice. In addition, this operative isn’t affected by the x" Devastating x weapon rule (i.e. Devastating with a distance) unless they are the target during that sequence.

operatives.name: GUNNER WITH FLAMER
operatives.description: Kasrkin Gunners provide their kill team with superior firepower. Whether it’s the searing heat of a plasma gun or the torrent of fire from a hot-shot volley gun, these elite troops are armed to the teeth to destroy their foes.
operatives.keywords: Kasrkin, Imperium, Astra Militarum, Gunner, Operative, Gunner or Sharpshooter

operatives.name: GUNNER WITH PLASMA GUN
operatives.description: Kasrkin Gunners provide their kill team with superior firepower. Whether it’s the searing heat of a plasma gun or the torrent of fire from a hot-shot volley gun, these elite troops are armed to the teeth to destroy their foes.
operatives.keywords: Kasrkin, Imperium, Astra Militarum, Gunner, Operative, Gunner or Sharpshooter

operatives.name: GUNNER WITH MELTAGUN
operatives.description: Kasrkin Gunners provide their kill team with superior firepower. Whether it’s the searing heat of a plasma gun or the torrent of fire from a hot-shot volley gun, these elite troops are armed to the teeth to destroy their foes.
operatives.keywords: Kasrkin, Imperium, Astra Militarum, Gunner, Operative, Gunner or Sharpshooter

operatives.name: GUNNER WITH GRENADE LAUNCHER
operatives.description: Kasrkin Gunners provide their kill team with superior firepower. Whether it’s the searing heat of a plasma gun or the torrent of fire from a hot-shot volley gun, these elite troops are armed to the teeth to destroy their foes.
operatives.keywords: Kasrkin, Imperium, Astra Militarum, Gunner, Operative, Gunner or Sharpshooter

operatives.name: GUNNER WITH HOT-SHOT VOLLEY GUN
operatives.description: Kasrkin Gunners provide their kill team with superior firepower. Whether it’s the searing heat of a plasma gun or the torrent of fire from a hot-shot volley gun, these elite troops are armed to the teeth to destroy their foes.
operatives.keywords: Kasrkin, Imperium, Astra Militarum, Gunner, Operative, Gunner or Sharpshooter

operatives.name: SHARPSHOOTER
operatives.description: Sharpshooters are the snipers of a Kasrkin kill team. They wield hot-shot long-las rifles, which are accurate, long-ranged weapons that can penetrate the thickest armour.
operatives.keywords: Kasrkin, Imperium, Astra Militarum, Operative, Sharpshooter, Gunner or Sharpshooter

abilities.name: Camo Cloak
abilities.rules: Whenever an operative is shooting this operative: - Ignore the Saturate weapon rule. - If you can retain any cover saves, you can retain one additional cover save, or you can retain one cover save as a critical success instead. This isn’t cumulative with improved cover saves from Vantage terrain.

operatives.name: RECON-TROOPER
operatives.description: Recon-troopers are the vanguard of a Kasrkin kill team, equipped with advanced auspex scanners to provide up-to-the-minute battlefield intelligence. They feed their comrades data on enemy movements, and even predict the best locations to aim their hot-shot weapons.
operatives.keywords: Kasrkin, Imperium, Astra Militarum, Operative, Recon-Trooper

abilities.name: Reconnoitre Killzone
abilities.rules: The Relocate strategy ploy costs you 0CP if this operative is the specified friendly KASRKIN operative.

actions.name: Auspex Scan
effects: ↘ Until the start of this operative’s next activation or until it’s incapacitated (whichever comes first), whenever an enemy operative is within 8" of this operative, that enemy operative is being scanned. Whenever a friendly KASRKIN operative is shooting an enemy operative that's being scanned, that enemy operative cannot be obscured.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

operatives.name: VOX-TROOPER
operatives.description: Carrying advanced vox systems, these Kasrkin are their kill team’s link with higher command. It is their job to relay orders and intelligence between senior officers and their comrades, all of whom wear their own vox-links for quick, intra-squad communication.
operatives.keywords: Kasrkin, Imperium, Astra Militarum, Operative, Vox-Trooper

actions.name: Battle Comms
effects: ↘ Select one other friendly KASRKIN operative. Until the end of that operative’s next activation, add 1 to its APL stat (to a maximum of 3 after all APL stat changes have been totalled).
conditions: This operative can perform this action twice during its activation, but cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative

operatives.name: TROOPER
operatives.description: Kasrkin Troopers are elite infantry, rigorously trained and equipped with the best weapons available to the Astra Militarum. They are the backbone of any Kasrkin kill team, providing solid support and disciplined fire.
operatives.keywords: Kasrkin, Imperium, Astra Militarum, Operative, Trooper

abilities.name: Adaptive Equipment
abilities.rules: You can do each of the following once per turning point: - One friendly KASRKIN TROOPER operative can perform the Smoke Grenade action. - One friendly KASRKIN TROOPER operative can perform the Stun Grenade action. The rules for these actions are found in universal equipment. Performing these actions using this rule doesn’t count towards their action limits (i.e. if you also select those grenades from equipment).

strategy_ploys.name: CLEARANCE SWEEP
strategy_ploys.description: After clearing their path, the Kasrkin continue their advance, delivering a crushing assault.
strategy_ploys.rules: Whenever a friendly KASRKIN operative performs a Charge action during its activation, or when it performs a Fight action during a counteraction, until the end of that action, that friendly operative’s weapons have the Ceaseless weapon rule.

strategy_ploys.name: ELIMINATION PATTERN
strategy_ploys.description: The Kasrkin focus their efforts on particularly dangerous or exposed targets, bringing them down with precise fire.
strategy_ploys.rules: Whenever a friendly KASRKIN operative is shooting against an operative that’s not in cover or is being scanned (see RECON-TROOPER), that weapon has the Piercing Crits 1 weapon rule, and if it’s a hot-shot weapon, it also has the Lethal 5+ weapon rule. This isn’t cumulative with being injured.

strategy_ploys.name: FOR CADIA!
strategy_ploys.description: Fueled by grim determination and loyalty to their home world, the Kasrkin fight with an unmatched ferocity.
strategy_ploys.rules: Add 1 to the Atk stat of friendly KASRKIN operatives’ melee weapons (to a maximum of 4). Whenever a friendly KASRKIN operative is fighting, the first time you strike during that sequence, inflict 1 additional damage.

strategy_ploys.name: ICE IN YOUR VEINS
strategy_ploys.description: The Kasrkin are legendary for their composure, even when suffering terrible wounds.
strategy_ploys.rules: Whenever an attack dice inflicts damage on a friendly KASRKIN operative, the first time an attack dice inflicts Normal Dmg of 3 or more on this operative during that sequence, subtract 1 from that inflicted damage.

strategy_ploys.name: LIGHT ’EM UP
strategy_ploys.description: Kasrkin unleash a withering storm of fire, overwhelming their foes.
