rules.rules: Whenever a friendly PATHFINDER operative performs the Markerlight action on their datacard, the selected enemy operative gains one of your Markerlight tokens (if it doesn’t already have one) [5, 6, 9, 14, 15, 18, 19]. Once during each of their activations, whenever an enemy operative that has any of your Markerlight tokens performs the Dash, Charge, Fall Back or Reposition action, remove one of those tokens. While only some PATHFINDER operatives can perform the Markerlight action, all PATHFINDER operatives can benefit from its effects. Whenever a friendly PATHFINDER operative is shooting with a weapon from its datacard (excluding ASSAULT GRENADIER’S fusion grenade), it has additional rules determined by the number of your Markerlight tokens the target has. These are cumulative, so if an enemy operative has two of your Markerlight tokens, the friendly operative shooting it has the rules for 1 and 2 tokens during that sequence. [6]

name: PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM
description: Masters of stealth and subterfuge, Phobos Strike Teams consist of Space Marine Infiltrators, Incursors and Reivers. Possessed of transhuman strength and equipped with a range of explosives, communications equipment and precise weaponry, they are capable of outmanoeuvring and overwhelming enemy forces many times their own size.

selection.operatives: ↘ 1 PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative selected from the following list: • INFILTRATOR SERGEANT • INCURSOR SERGEANT • REIVER SERGEANT with one of the following options: ○ Special issue bolt pistol; combat knife ○ Bolt carbine; fists ↘ 5 PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operatives selected from the following list: • INFILTRATOR COMMSMAN • INFILTRATOR HELIX ADEPT • INFILTRATOR SABOTEUR • INFILTRATOR VETERAN • INFILTRATOR VOXBREAKER • INFILTRATOR WARRIOR • INCURSOR MARKSMAN • INCURSOR MINELAYER • INCURSOR WARRIOR • REIVER WARRIOR with one of the following options: ○ Special issue bolt pistol; combat knife ○ Bolt carbine; fists •ther than WARRIOR operatives, your kill team can only include each operative on this list once.Your kill team can only include each operative on this list once, unless you’re not including any REQUISITIONED operatives, in which case you can include up to two GUN SERVITOR operatives, but each one must have different options. Your kill team (including any REQUISITIONED operatives) cannot include more than one weapon with the Piercing 2 weapon rule, and cannot include more than three weapons with the Piercing X (excluding Piercing Crits X) weapon rule combined.

operatives.name: INFILTRATOR SERGEANT
operatives.description: Exemplar to their brothers; strategic and tactical leader of exceptional skill; deadly enemy to the Emperor’s foes: the Infiltrator Sergeant must be all of these things, for it is by his words and actions that the Phobos Strike Team stands or falls.
operatives.keywords: PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM, Imperium, Adeptus Astartes, Sergeant, Leader, Infiltrator

abilities.name: Strategic Oversight
abilities.rules: In the Ready step of each Strategy phase, when you gain CP, if this operative is in the killzone and not within control range of enemy operatives, you can use this rule. If you do, roll one D6: on a 4+, you gain one additional CP.

abilities.name: Comms Array
abilities.rules: Once per turning point, during a friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative’s activation or counteraction, before or after it performs an action, if this operative is in the killzone, you can change one strategy ploy you’ve used this turning point (it doesn’t cost you any CP to do so).

operatives.name: INCURSOR SERGEANT
operatives.description: Incursor Sergeants lead their Incursor battle-brothers.
operatives.keywords: PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM, Imperium, Adeptus Astartes, Sergeant, Leader, Incursor

operatives.name: REIVER SERGEANT
operatives.description: Reiver Sergeants lead their Reiver battle-brothers.
operatives.keywords: PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM, Imperium, Adeptus Astartes, Sergeant, Leader, Reiver

abilities.name: Grav-chute and Grapnel Launcher
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is climbing up, you can treat the vertical distance as 2" (regardless of how far the operative actually moves vertically). Whenever this operative is dropping, ignore the vertical distance.

abilities.name: Vanguard
abilities.rules: Once per turning point, one friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative with this rule can perform the Pick Up Marker or a mission action for 1 less AP.

operatives.name: INFILTRATOR COMMSMAN
operatives.description: The Infiltrator Commsman acts as a strategic nexus upon the battlefield, a conduit through which vox-exchanges and intelligence inloads pass like lightning. The presence of such a battle-brother increases the strike team’s versatility and swiftness of action.
operatives.keywords: PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM, Imperium, Adeptus Astartes, Infiltrator, Commsman

abilities.name: Strategic Oversight
abilities.rules: In the Ready step of each Strategy phase, when you gain CP, if this operative is in the killzone and not within control range of enemy operatives, you can use this rule. If you do, roll one D6: on a 4+, you gain one additional CP.

abilities.name: Comms Array
abilities.rules: Once per turning point, during a friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative’s activation or counteraction, before or after it performs an action, if this operative is in the killzone, you can change one strategy ploy you’ve used this turning point (it doesn’t cost you any CP to do so).

operatives.name: INFILTRATOR HELIX ADEPT
operatives.description: Operating as they do – far behind enemy lines without support – Phobos Strike Teams require the medicae support of Helix Adepts to get wounded battle-brothers back into the fight, and to reclaim the gene-seed of the slain for the Chapter.
operatives.keywords: PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM, Imperium, Adeptus Astartes, Infiltrator, Medic, Helix Adept

abilities.name: Medic!
abilities.rules: The first time during each turning point that another friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative would be incapacitated while visible to and within 3" of this operative, you can use this rule, providing neither this nor that operative is within control range of enemy operatives. If you do, that friendly operative isn’t incapacitated and has 1 wound remaining and cannot be incapacitated for the remainder of the action. After that action, that friendly operative can then immediately perform a free Dash action, but must end that move within this operative’s control range. Subtract 1 from this and that operative’s APL stats until the end of their next activations respectively, and if this rule was used during that friendly operative’s activation, that activation ends. You cannot use this rule if this operative is incapacitated, or if it's a Shoot action and this operative would be a primary or secondary target.

actions.name: Helix Gauntlet
effects: ↘ Select one friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative within this operative’s control range to regain up to D3+3 lost wounds. It cannot be an operative that the Medic! rule was used on during this turning point.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

operatives.name: INFILTRATOR SABOTEUR
operatives.description: Infiltrator Saboteurs are part of Phobos Strike Teams.
operatives.keywords: PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM, Imperium, Adeptus Astartes, Saboteur, Infiltrator

weapons.name: REMOTE DETONATOR
weapons.rules: Heavy (Dash only), Limited 1, Piercing 1, Silent, Detonate*

abilities.name: Plant Explosives
abilities.rules: This operative is carrying your Explosives marker. It can perform the Pick Up Marker action on that marker, and whenever it performs the Place Marker action on that marker, it can immediately perform a free Dash action.

operatives.name: INFILTRATOR VETERAN
operatives.description: Infiltrator Veterans are part of Phobos Strike Teams.
operatives.keywords: PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM, Imperium, Adeptus Astartes, Infiltrator, Veteran

abilities.name: Custom
abilities.rules: At the end of the Select Operatives step, if this operative is selected for deployment, select up to two of the following weapon rules for this weapon to have for the battle: Balanced, Lethal 5+, Piercing Crits 1, Rending, Saturate.

operatives.name: INFILTRATOR VOXBREAKER
operatives.description: The Voxbreaker makes war in both the physical and data-spectral realms. Not only does their specialised equipment allow them to scan and isolate enemy threats, but they can also break into the foe’s communications and plunder them for strategic intelligence.
operatives.keywords: PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM, Imperium, Adeptus Astartes, Infiltrator, Voxbreaker

abilities.name: Voxbreak
abilities.rules: Whenever an enemy operative is within 6" of this operative, your opponent cannot re-roll their attack or defence dice for that operative.

actions.name: AUSPEX SCAN
effects: ↘ Until the start of this operative’s next activation or until it’s incapacitated (whichever comes first), whenever a friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative is shooting an enemy operative within 8" of this operative, that enemy operative cannot be obscured; if that friendly operative is an INCURSOR, its ranged weapons also have the Seek Light weapon rule.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

operatives.name: INFILTRATOR WARRIOR
operatives.description: The Infiltrators who fight as part of Phobos Strike Teams are swift and aggressive in thought and deed, even by the standards of their warrior brotherhood. Few foes can long evade their pinpoint volleys or the bone-crushing blows of their armoured fists.
operatives.keywords: PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM, Imperium, Adeptus Astartes, Infiltrator, Warrior

abilities.name: Vanguard
abilities.rules: Once per turning point, one friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative with this rule can perform the Pick Up Marker or a mission action for 1 less AP.

operatives.name: INCURSOR MARKSMAN
operatives.description: Incursor Marksmans are part of Phobos Strike Teams.
operatives.keywords: PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM, Imperium, Adeptus Astartes, Incursor, Marksman

abilities.name: Track Target
abilities.rules: This operative can perform the Guard action regardless of the killzone (see close quarters rules, Kill Team Core Book). It can perform the Guard action while it has a Conceal order, but when you perform the free Shoot or Fight action during the interruption, you must change its order to Engage.

operatives.name: INCURSOR MINELAYER
operatives.description: Incursor Minelayers are part of Phobos Strike Teams.
operatives.keywords: PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM, Imperium, Adeptus Astartes, Incursor, Minelayer

abilities.name: Haywire Mine
abilities.rules: This operative is carrying your Haywire Mine marker. It can perform the Pick Up Marker action on that marker, but that marker cannot be placed within an enemy operative’s control range (if this operative is incapacitated while carrying that marker and that marker cannot be placed, it’s removed with this operative).

abilities.name: Proximity Mine
abilities.rules: The first time your Haywire Mine marker is within another operative’s control range, remove that marker, subtract 1 from that operative’s APL stat until the end of its next activation, and inflict 2D3+3 damage on it; if it isn’t incapacitated, end its action (if any), even if that action’s effects aren’t fulfilled. If it cannot be placed, move it the minimum amount to do so. Note that this operative is ignored for these effects (i.e. it cannot set it off or take damage from that marker).

operatives.name: INCURSOR WARRIOR
operatives.description: Incursor Warriors are part of Phobos Strike Teams.
operatives.keywords: PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM, Imperium, Adeptus Astartes, Incursor, Warrior

abilities.name: Vanguard
abilities.rules: Once per turning point, one friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative with this rule can perform the Pick Up Marker or a mission action for 1 less AP.

operatives.name: REIVER WARRIOR
operatives.description: Reiver Warriors are part of Phobos Strike Teams.
operatives.keywords: PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM, Imperium, Adeptus Astartes, Reiver, Warrior

abilities.name: Grav-chute and Grapnel Launcher
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is climbing up, you can treat the vertical distance as 2" (regardless of how far the operative actually moves vertically). Whenever this operative is dropping, ignore the vertical distance.

abilities.name: Vanguard
abilities.rules: Once per turning point, one friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative with this rule can perform the Pick Up Marker or a mission action for 1 less AP.

strategy_ploys.name: OMNI-SCRAMBLER
strategy_ploys.description: STRATEGIC GAMBIT if a friendly INFILTRATOR operative is in the killzone. Select one enemy operative visible to a friendly INFILTRATOR operative, or within 6" of a friendly VOXBREAKER operative. In the following Firefight phase, that enemy operative cannot be activated or perform actions until one of the following is true: • Your opponent has activated a number of enemy operatives equal to the number of friendly INFILTRATOR operatives in the killzone when this STRATEGIC GAMBIT was used. • It’s the last enemy operative to be activated.
strategy_ploys.rules: STRATEGIC GAMBIT if a friendly INFILTRATOR operative is in the killzone. Select one enemy operative visible to a friendly INFILTRATOR operative, or within 6" of a friendly VOXBREAKER operative. In the following Firefight phase, that enemy operative cannot be activated or perform actions until one of the following is true: • Your opponent has activated a number of enemy operatives equal to the number of friendly INFILTRATOR operatives in the killzone when this STRATEGIC GAMBIT was used. • It’s the last enemy operative to be activated.

strategy_ploys.name: TERROR
strategy_ploys.description: Whenever an enemy operative is within 3" of friendly REIVER operatives, your opponent must spend 1 additional AP for that enemy operative to perform the Pick Up Marker and mission actions. Whenever determining control of a marker, treat the total APL stat of enemy operatives that contest it as 1 lower if at least one of those enemy operatives is within 3" of friendly REIVER operatives. Note this isn’t a change to the APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this.
strategy_ploys.rules: Whenever an enemy operative is within 3" of friendly REIVER operatives, your opponent must spend 1 additional AP for that enemy operative to perform the Pick Up Marker and mission actions. Whenever determining control of a marker, treat the total APL stat of enemy operatives that contest it as 1 lower if at least one of those enemy operatives is within 3" of friendly REIVER operatives. Note this isn’t a change to the APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this.

strategy_ploys.name: ASTARTES
strategy_ploys.description: During each friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative’s activation, it can perform either two Shoot actions or two Fight actions. If it’s two Shoot actions, a bolt weapon must be selected for at least one of them. A bolt weapon is any ranged weapon that includes ‘bolt’ in its name, e.g. marksman bolt carbine, special issue bolt pistol, etc.
strategy_ploys.rules: During each friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative’s activation, it can perform either two Shoot actions or two Fight actions. If it’s two Shoot actions, a bolt weapon must be selected for at least one of them. A bolt weapon is any ranged weapon that includes ‘bolt’ in its name, e.g. marksman bolt carbine, special issue bolt pistol, etc.

strategy_ploys.name: MULTI-SPECTRUM ARRAY
strategy_ploys.description: Whenever a friendly INCURSOR operative is shooting, enemy operatives cannot be obscured.
strategy_ploys.rules: Whenever a friendly INCURSOR operative is shooting, enemy operatives cannot be obscured.

equipment.name: PURITY SEALS
equipment.description: Awarded by the Chapter’s Chaplains, purity seals are inscribed with blessings and inspire the bearer to fight with increased vigour.
equipment.rules: Once per turning point, when a friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative is shooting, fighting or retaliating, if you roll two or more fails, you can discard one of them to retain another as a normal success instead.

rules.name: OMNI-SCRAMBLER
rules.description: STRATEGIC GAMBIT if a friendly INFILTRATOR operative is in the killzone. Select one enemy operative visible to a friendly INFILTRATOR operative, or within 6" of a friendly VOXBREAKER operative. In the following Firefight phase, that enemy operative cannot be activated or perform actions until one of the following is true: • Your opponent has activated a number of enemy operatives equal to the number of friendly INFILTRATOR operatives in the killzone when this STRATEGIC GAMBIT was used. • It’s the last enemy operative to be activated.
rules.rules: STRATEGIC GAMBIT if a friendly INFILTRATOR operative is in the killzone. Select one enemy operative visible to a friendly INFILTRATOR operative, or within 6" of a friendly VOXBREAKER operative. In the following Firefight phase, that enemy operative cannot be activated or perform actions until one of the following is true: • Your opponent has activated a number of enemy operatives equal to the number of friendly INFILTRATOR operatives in the killzone when this STRATEGIC GAMBIT was used. • It’s the last enemy operative to be activated.

rules.name: TERROR
rules.description: Whenever an enemy operative is within 3" of friendly REIVER operatives, your opponent must spend 1 additional AP for that enemy operative to perform the Pick Up Marker and mission actions. Whenever determining control of a marker, treat the total APL stat of enemy operatives that contest it as 1 lower if at least one of those enemy operatives is within 3" of friendly REIVER operatives. Note this isn’t a change to the APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this.
rules.rules: Whenever an enemy operative is within 3" of friendly REIVER operatives, your opponent must spend 1 additional AP for that enemy operative to perform the Pick Up Marker and mission actions. Whenever determining control of a marker, treat the total APL stat of enemy operatives that contest it as 1 lower if at least one of those enemy operatives is within 3" of friendly REIVER operatives. Note this isn’t a change to the APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this.

rules.name: ASTARTES
rules.description: During each friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative’s activation, it can perform either two Shoot actions or two Fight actions. If it’s two Shoot actions, a bolt weapon must be selected for at least one of them. A bolt weapon is any ranged weapon that includes ‘bolt’ in its name, e.g. marksman bolt carbine, special issue bolt pistol, etc.
rules.rules: During each friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative’s activation, it can perform either two Shoot actions or two Fight actions. If it’s two Shoot actions, a bolt weapon must be selected for at least one of them. A bolt weapon is any ranged weapon that includes ‘bolt’ in its name, e.g. marksman bolt carbine, special issue bolt pistol, etc.

rules.name: MULTI-SPECTRUM ARRAY
rules.description: Feeding into the auto-senses of the bearer’s armour, the multi-spectrum array’s powerful augurs help to reveal hidden foes.
rules.rules: Whenever a friendly INCURSOR operative is shooting, enemy operatives cannot be obscured.

rules.name: DURABLE
rules.description: Phobos Strike Team operatives possess transhuman durability.
rules.rules: You can ignore any changes to the stats of friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operatives from being injured (including their weapons’ stats).

rules.name: DEADLY SHOTS
rules.description: Space Marines spend countless hours perfecting their marksmanship.
rules.rules: Whenever a friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative is shooting during an activation in which it hasn’t performed the Charge, Fall Back or Reposition action, or against an operative that isn’t in cover, that friendly operative’s ranged weapons have the Balanced weapon rule. Note that for the first requirement, that operative isn’t restricted from performing those actions after shooting.

name: PLAGUE MARINES
description: Plague Marine kill teams are made up of mutated, diseased warriors.

selection.operatives: ↘ 1 PLAGUE MARINES CHAMPION operative ↘ 5 PLAGUE MARINES operatives selected from the following list: • BOMBARDIER • FIGHTER • HEAVY GUNNER • ICON BEARER • MALIGNANT PLAGUECASTER • WARRIOR Your kill team can only include each operative on this list once.

operatives.name: PLAGUE MARINE CHAMPION
operatives.description: Plague Marine Champions lead their kill teams.
operatives.keywords: PLAGUE MARINE, Chaos, Heretic Astartes, Leader, Champion

abilities.name: Grandfather's Blessing
abilities.rules: Whenever an enemy operative that has one of your Poison tokens loses one or more wounds within 7" of this operative, this operative regains up to an equal number of lost wounds (to a maximum of 3 lost wounds per turning point, and only if this operative isn’t incapacitated).

operatives.name: MALIGNANT PLAGUECASTER
operatives.description: Balefire Acolytes are psykers blessed by the Chaos Gods with the dark power of the empyrean, which they turn indiscriminately upon the foe. Malignant Plaguecasters spread Nurgle's blighted gifts.
operatives.keywords: PLAGUE MARINE, Operative, Chaos, Heretic Astartes, Psyker, Malignant Plaguecaster

actions.name: Poisonous Miasma
effects: PSYCHIC. Select one enemy operative visible to and within 7" of this operative, or one enemy operative that’s a valid target for this operative. That enemy operative gains one of your Poison tokens (if it doesn’t already have one). If it already has one, inflict 3 damage on that enemy operative instead.
conditions: An operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

actions.name: Putrescent Vitality
effects: PSYCHIC. Select one friendly operative visible to and within 3" of this operative, then roll 2D6: if the result is 7, the selected operative regains 7 lost wounds; otherwise, the selected operative regains lost wounds equal to the highest D6.
conditions: An operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

operatives.name: PLAGUE MARINE BOMBARDIER
operatives.description: Plague Marine Bombardiers are equipped with plague spewers.
operatives.keywords: PLAGUE MARINE, Operative, Chaos, Heretic Astartes, Bombardier

operatives.name: PLAGUE MARINE FIGHTER
operatives.description: Plague Marine Fighters wield flails of corruption.
operatives.keywords: PLAGUE MARINE, Operative, Chaos, Heretic Astartes, Fighter

actions.name: Flail
effects: Inflict D3+2 damage on each other operative that’s both visible to and within 2" of this operative. Roll separately for each: if it’s an enemy operative, on a 3, that enemy operative also gains one of your Poison tokens (if it doesn’t already have one).
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while it has a Conceal order, or during an activation in which it has performed more than one Fight action, and it cannot perform more than one Fight action during an activation in which it performs this action.

operatives.name: PLAGUE MARINE ICON BEARER
operatives.description: Many Heretic Astartes kill teams include Icon Bearers – warriors bearing totems, banners or standards dedicated to the glory of the Dark Gods.
operatives.keywords: PLAGUE MARINE, Operative, Chaos, Heretic Astartes, Icon Bearer

abilities.name: Icon Bearer
abilities.rules: Whenever determining control of a marker, treat this operative’s APL stat as 1 higher. Note this isn’t a change to its APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this.

abilities.name: Icon of Contagion
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is within your opponent’s territory, the Contagion strategy ploy costs you 0CP.

operatives.name: PLAGUE MARINE WARRIOR
operatives.description: Plague Marine Warriors are standard operatives in a Plague Marine kill team.
operatives.keywords: PLAGUE MARINE, Operative, Chaos, Heretic Astartes, Warrior

abilities.name: Repulsive Fortitude
abilities.rules: Whenever an operative is shooting this operative, defence dice results of 5+ are critical successes.

operatives.name: PLAGUE MARINE HEAVY GUNNER
operatives.description: Plague Marine Heavy Gunners bring potent ranged firepower.
operatives.keywords: PLAGUE MARINE, Operative, Chaos, Heretic Astartes, Heavy Gunner

strategy_ploys.name: CLOUD OF FLIES
strategy_ploys.description: A swarming cloud of flies protects PLAGUE MARINES.
strategy_ploys.rules: Whenever an operative is shooting a friendly PLAGUE MARINES operative, if that friendly operative is wholly within 1" of a terrain feature that provides Cover, that friendly operative is obscured.

strategy_ploys.name: CONTAGION
strategy_ploys.description: Grandfather Nurgle’s blessings imbue the very air around His favoured warriors with a sickening essence. Disease and infection spread from them, consuming all they touch.
strategy_ploys.rules: Until the Ready step of the next Strategy phase, whenever an enemy operative is within 3" of a friendly PLAGUE MARINES operative, that enemy operative gains one of your Poison tokens (if it doesn’t already have one).

firefight_ploys.name: POISONOUS DEMISE
firefight_ploys.description: Upon death, a PLAGUE MARINES body bursts with Nurgle's blessings.
firefight_ploys.rules: Use this firefight ploy when a friendly PLAGUE MARINES operative is incapacitated, before it’s removed from the killzone. Inflict D3 damage on each enemy operative within 3" of it (roll separately for each). If the D3 result is a 3, each of those enemy operatives also gains one of your Poison tokens (if it doesn’t already have one).

firefight_ploys.name: DIG IN
firefight_ploys.description: Plague Marines have an iron will and are resistant to wounds that would fell lesser beings.
firefight_ploys.rules: Use this firefight ploy when an operative is shooting a friendly PLAGUE MARINES operative, in the Roll Defence Dice step. You can retain one of your normal successes as a critical success instead.

equipment.name: NOXIOUS EFFLUVIUM
equipment.description: A vile concoction that causes immediate sickness and a lingering disease.
equipment.rules: Once per battle, a friendly PLAGUE MARINES operative can use the following ranged weapon: NAME ATK HIT DMG Noxious Effluvium 4 3+ 2/3 Range 6", Blast 2", Limited 1, Poison*, Stun. This weapon’s rules take precedence over any other rules for the operative (e.g. if the operative has a similar weapon, it uses these stats instead).

equipment.name: BLIGHT GRENADE
equipment.description: A grenade bursting with deadly plague and disease.
equipment.rules: Once per battle, a friendly PLAGUE MARINES operative can use the following ranged weapon: NAME ATK HIT DMG Blight Grenade 4 3+ 3/4 Range 6", Blast 2", Limited 1, Poison*, Torrent 1". This weapon’s rules take precedence over any other rules for the operative (e.g. if the operative has a similar weapon, it uses these stats instead).

equipment.name: VIRULENT BLADE
equipment.description: A blade coated in festering contagions.
equipment.rules: Once per turning point, when a friendly PLAGUE MARINES operative is fighting or retaliating, its melee weapon has the Poison* weapon rule. If it already has that rule, add 1 to its Critical Damage characteristic instead.

equipment.name: VILE CONTAGION
equipment.description: The very presence of the Plague Marines spreads sickness and decay.
equipment.rules: Whenever an enemy operative is within 3" of a friendly PLAGUE MARINES operative, worsen the Hit characteristic of that enemy operative’s weapons by 1 (this isn’t cumulative with being injured). Each enemy operative can only be affected by this rule once per turning point.

rules.name: *POISON
rules.description: In the Resolve Attack Dice step, if you inflict damage with any successes, the operative this weapon is being used against (excluding friendly PLAGUE MARINES operatives) gains one of your Poison tokens (if it doesn’t already have one). Whenever an operative that has one of your Poison tokens is activated, inflict 1 damage on it.
rules.rules: In the Resolve Attack Dice step, if you inflict damage with any successes, the operative this weapon is being used against (excluding friendly PLAGUE MARINES operatives) gains one of your Poison tokens (if it doesn’t already have one). Whenever an operative that has one of your Poison tokens is activated, inflict 1 damage on it.

rules.name: *TOXIC
rules.description: Whenever this operative is using this weapon against an enemy operative that has one of your Poison tokens, add 1 to both Dmg stats of this weapon.
rules.rules: Whenever this operative is using this weapon against an enemy operative that has one of your Poison tokens, add 1 to both Dmg stats of this weapon.

rules.name: ASTARTES
rules.description: Space Marines are genetically augmented transhumans forged for only one purpose: war.
rules.rules: During each friendly PLAGUE MARINES operative’s activation, it can perform either two Shoot actions or two Fight actions. If it’s two Shoot actions, a bolt pistol, boltgun or PSYCHIC weapon must be selected for at least one of them. You cannot select the same PSYCHIC ranged weapon more than once per activation. Each friendly PLAGUE MARINES operative can counteract regardless of its order.

rules.name: DISGUSTINGLY RESILIENT
rules.description: The monstrous transformations wrought upon these hulking brutes have rendered their aberrant physiologies incredibly resistant to harm.
rules.rules: Whenever an attack dice inflicts damage of 3 or more on a friendly PLAGUE MARINES operative, roll one D6: on a 4+, subtract 1 from that inflicted damage.

name: RATLING
description: This kill team has numerous synergies that make it much greater than the sum of its smaller parts. For example, a sniper rifle is fearsome enough, but giving it Lethal 5+ from the Fixer, Seek Light from the Spotter (while ignoring obscured), and re-rolls from ammo caches is a deadly combo. Once you line all these up, your opponent will be wary of allowing their operatives to be a valid target. Because of this, it can be tempting to set up a defensive gun line to shoot your RATLING.

selection.operatives: ↘ 1 RATLING FIXER operative with one of the following options: ○ Battle rifle; fists ○ Sniper rifle; fists ↘ 10 RATLING operatives selected from the following list: • BATTLEMUTT • BULLGRYN with one option from each of the following: ○ Grenadier gauntlet or power maul ○ Brute shield or slabshield • OGRYN • BIG SHOT • BOMBER • HARDBIT • RAIDER • SNEAK • SNIPER • SPOTTER • STASHMASTER • VOX-THIEF Other than BULLGRYN, OGRYN and SNIPER operatives, your kill team can only include each operative on this list once. Your kill team can only include up to three of these operatives combined. Up to three times, instead of selecting one of these operatives, you can select one RATLING ploy to cost you 0CP for the battle.

operatives.name: RATLING FIXER
operatives.description: Ratling Fixers are key operatives in a RATLING kill team.
operatives.keywords: RATLING, Fixer, Leader, Astra Militarum, Imperium

abilities.name: Munitorum Contacts
abilities.rules: You can select one additional equipment option.

operatives.name: RATLING BATTLEMUTT
operatives.description: Battlemutts are animal companions in a RATLING kill team.
operatives.keywords: RATLING, Operative, Imperium, Astra Militarum, Battlemutt

abilities.name: Early Warning
abilities.rules: Once per turning point, after an enemy operative performs an action in which it moves, you can interrupt that activation (or counteraction) to use this rule. If you do, each friendly RATLING operative (excluding OGRYN and BULLGRYN) within 6" of this operative and within 2" of that enemy operative can perform a free Dash action or a free Fall Back action, but it cannot move more than 3". In either case, each one cannot finish that move within 2" of an enemy operative unless it's not visible to every enemy operative when it finishes that move (if this isn't possible for an operative, it cannot move).

abilities.name: Beast
abilities.rules: This operative cannot perform any actions other than Charge, Dash, Fall Back, Fight and Reposition. It cannot use any weapons that aren't on its datacard.

operatives.name: BULLGRYN
operatives.description: Particularly obstinate and resilient Ogryns are selected to serve as Bullgryns. They are outfitted with thick armour, Heavy shields and Brutal melee weapons, enabling them to bludgeon their foes to death in the thick of combat.
operatives.keywords: RATLING, Imperium, Astra Militarum, Bullgryn, Three of, Operative

abilities.name: Shield
abilities.rules: If this operative has a slabshield, it has a 3+ Save stat; if it has a brute shield, whenever it's fighting or retaliating, each of your blocks can be allocated to block two unresolved successes (instead of one).

operatives.name: RATLING BIG SHOT
operatives.description: Big Shots are operatives in a RATLING kill team. Note: Specific stats, weapons, abilities, and actions for this operative are not detailed in the provided source excerpts.
operatives.keywords: RATLING, Big Shot, Operative, Imperium, Astra Militarum

operatives.name: RATLING BOMBER
operatives.description: Bombers are operatives in a RATLING kill team.
operatives.keywords: RATLING, Operative, Bomber, Imperium, Astra Militarum

abilities.name: Tripwire
abilities.rules: When setting up equipment before the battle, you can set up two of your Tripwire markers up wholly within your territory and more than 2" from other markers, access points and Accessible terrain. The first time that marker is within an enemy operative's control range, end that operative's action (if any), remove that marker and subtract 1 from that operative's APL stat until the end of its next activation.

abilities.name: Mine
abilities.rules: Mines you select from universal equipment inflict 2D3+3 damage instead, and friendly RATLING operatives (excluding OGRYN and BULLGRYN) are ignored for its effects (i.e. they can't trigger it or take damage from it). This takes precedence over the normal mines rules.

operatives.name: RATLING HARDBIT
operatives.description: Hardbits are operatives in a RATLING kill team. Note: Specific stats, weapons, abilities, and actions for this operative are not detailed in the provided source excerpts.
operatives.keywords: RATLING, Operative, Imperium, Astra Militarum, Hardbit

abilities.name: Lie in Wait
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is retaliating while Light or Heavy terrain is within its control range, you resolve the first attack dice (i.e. defender instead of attacker).

operatives.name: RATLING RAIDER
operatives.description: Raiders are operatives in a RATLING kill team. Note: Specific stats, weapons, abilities, and actions for this operative are not detailed in the provided source excerpts.
operatives.keywords: RATLING, Operative, Imperium, Astra Militarum, Raider

abilities.name: Grappling Hook
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is climbing up, you can treat the vertical distance as 2" (regardless of how far the operative actually moves vertically).

actions.name: Slingshot
effects: ↘ Select a point on a terrain feature that's visible to, horizontally within 6" of and higher than this operative. Remove this operative from the killzone and set it back up wholly within x+1" horizontally of that point, not within control range of an enemy operative, and with that point visible to it. X is that point's height, rounded to the nearest inch (to a maximum of 6").
conditions: This action is treated as a Reposition action. This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative, or during an activation in which it performed the Charge, Fall Back, or Shoot action (or vice versa).

operatives.name: RATLING SNEAK
operatives.description: Sneaks are operatives in a RATLING kill team. Note: Specific stats, weapons, abilities, and actions for this operative are not detailed in the provided source excerpts.
operatives.keywords: RATLING, Imperium, Astra Militarum, Operative, Sneak

abilities.name: Evade
abilities.rules: Once per turning point, after an enemy operative performs an action, you can interrupt that activation (or counteraction) and perform a free Dash action with this operative. Note this operative cannot use the Scarper faction rule (it has this rule instead).

actions.name: Optics
effects: ↘ Until the start of this operative's next activation, whenever it's shooting, enemy operatives cannot be obscured.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

operatives.name: OGRYN
operatives.description: Burly abhumans originating from high-gravity planets, Ogryns are occasionally fielded alongside RATLINGs. These hulking soldiers view RATLINGs as their ‘little mates’, and are extremely protective of them.
operatives.keywords: Operative, RATLING, Imperium, Astra Militarum, Ogryn, Three of

abilities.name: Bayonet Charge
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative finishes moving during the Charge action, you can inflict D3+1 damage on one enemy operative within its control range.

operatives.name: RATLING SNIPER
operatives.description: Snipers are operatives in a RATLING kill team. Note: Specific stats, weapons, abilities, and actions for this operative are not detailed in the provided source excerpts.
operatives.keywords: Operative, Sniper, Imperium, Astra Militarum, RATLING

operatives.name: RATLING SPOTTER
operatives.description: Spotters possess great focus, accurately guiding salvoes of mortar fire from safe lines even when under immense pressure. With this they can stymie enemy attacks or pin them down in their defences. Note: Specific stats, weapons, abilities, and actions for this operative are not detailed in the provided source excerpts specific to RATLINGs.
operatives.keywords: RATLING, Imperium, Astra Militarum, Spotter, Operative

operatives.name: RATLING STASHMASTER
operatives.description: Stashmasters are operatives in a RATLING kill team. Note: Specific stats, weapons, abilities, and actions for this operative are not detailed in the provided source excerpts.
operatives.keywords: Operative, RATLING, Imperium, Astra Militarum, Stashmaster

abilities.name: Light-fingered
abilities.rules: Once during each of this operative's activations, it can perform the Place Marker, Pick Up Marker or a mission action for 1 less AP.

abilities.name: Well Stocked
abilities.rules: If you select an Ammo Cache from universal equipment, you can set up an additional Ammo Cache marker.

operatives.name: RATLING VOX-THIEF
operatives.description: Vox-thieves utilise listening devices to intercept enemy communications. These devices also function as midrange vox-casters. Note: Specific stats, weapons, abilities, and actions for this operative are not detailed in the provided source excerpts.
operatives.keywords: Operative, Imperium, Astra Militarum, Vox-thief, RATLING

actions.name: Intercept Communications
effects: ↘ SUPPORT. Select one other friendly RATLING operative visible to and within 6" of this operative. Until the end of its next activation, add 1 to that operative's APL stat.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

equipment.name: DYNAMITE
equipment.description: Dynamite is an explosive device.
equipment.rules: Once per turning point, a friendly KOMMANDO operative (excluding BOMB SQUIG and GROT) can use the following ranged weapon: NAME ATK HIT DMG WR Dynamite 5 4+ 4/5 Range 4", Blast 1", Heavy (Reposition only), Saturate

equipment.name: HARPOON
equipment.description: This weapon fires a sharp, barbed projectile that snags any foes it doesn’t kill outright, preventing them from moving.
equipment.rules: Once per turning point, a friendly KOMMANDO operative (excluding BOMB SQUIG and GROT) can use the following ranged weapon: NAME ATK HIT DMG WR Harpoon 4 4+ 4/5 Range 8", Lethal 5+, Stun

rules.name: SCARPER
rules.description: After each enemy operative's activation, before the next operative is activated, you can perform a free Dash action with one friendly RATLING operating (excluding BULLGRYN, OGRYN, and SNEAK), but it cannot finish that move within 3" of an enemy operative unless it's not visible to every enemy operative when it finishes that move. Each friendly operative can only do this once per turning point, and cannot do so after the final activation of the turning point. You cannot use this rule after consecutive enemy activations during the same turning point (in other words, after using this rule, you must skip the next opportunity during that turning point before you can use it again).
rules.rules: After each enemy operative's activation, before the next operative is activated, you can perform a free Dash action with one friendly RATLING operating (excluding BULLGRYN, OGRYN, and SNEAK), but it cannot finish that move within 3" of an enemy operative unless it's not visible to every enemy operative when it finishes that move. Each friendly operative can only do this once per turning point, and cannot do so after the final activation of the turning point. You cannot use this rule after consecutive enemy activations during the same turning point (in other words, after using this rule, you must skip the next opportunity during that turning point before you can use it again).

name: RAVENER
description: Raveners are voracious subterranean predators, burrowing through the earth and bursting forth to ambush their prey. Their serpentine bodies, scything talons, and venomous capabilities make them terrifying close-quarters combatants, especially when operating from their extensive tunnel networks.

selection.operatives: ↘ 1 RAVENER PRIME operative with one of the following options: • Rend claws and scything talons; tail blade • Two pairs of scything talons ↘ 5 RAVENER operatives selected from the following list: • FELLTALON with rending claws and toxic glands • TREMORSCYTHE with rending claws and barbed tail • VENOMSPITTER with rending claws and venom cannon • WRECKER with rending claws and bone mace • WARRIOR with two pairs of scything talons Other than WARRIOR operatives, your kill team can only include each operative on this list once.

operatives.name: RAVENER PRIME
operatives.description: Ravener Primes are apex predators, leading their broods with a terrifying instinct for the hunt. Their enhanced senses and formidable weaponry make them deadly in any environment, especially when emerging from their subterranean tunnels to strike at unsuspecting foes.
operatives.keywords: RAVENER, TYRANID, GREAT DEVOURER, LEADER, PRIME

abilities.name: Neuropredatory Crest
abilities.rules: Whenever determining control of a marker, treat the total APL stat of enemy operatives that contest it as 1 lower if at least one of those enemy operatives is within 3" of this operative. Note this isn't a change to its APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this. Whenever an enemy operative is within 3" of this operative: • Your opponent must spend 1 additional AP for that enemy operative to perform the Pick Up Marker and mission actions. • Your opponent cannot re-roll their attack or defence dice for that operative.

abilities.name: Synaptic Link
abilities.rules: STRATEGIC GAMBIT if this operative isn't incapacitated. Roll one D6 and compare the result to the number of the current turning point; if the result is: • Higher: you gain 1CP. • Equal: nothing happens. • Less: inflict damage on this operative equal to the result.

operatives.name: FELLTALON
operatives.description: Felltalons are Raveners equipped with toxic glands and scything talons, making them capable of inflicting devastating poisoned attacks on their foes.
operatives.keywords: RAVENER, TYRANID, GREAT DEVOURER, FELLTALON, OPERATIVE

abilities.name: Toxic Surge
abilities.rules: Once per turning point, when this operative performs the Charge action, until the end of that action, its toxic scythes have the Brutal weapon rule and you can re-roll any of your attack dice results of 1.

actions.name: Toxic Lunge
effects: • Select one enemy operative within 2" of this operative. Alternatively, if this operative is underground, select one enemy operative on your TUNNEL. Inflict D3+2 damage on that enemy operative and it gains one of your Poison tokens (if it doesn't already have one).
conditions: This operative can perform this action while underground (this takes precedence over the normal Burrow rules).

operatives.name: VENOMSPITTER
operatives.description: Venomspitters are equipped with venom bolts capable of piercing armour and unleashing devastating poison, making them a threat at both range and in close combat.
operatives.keywords: RAVENER, TYRANID, GREAT DEVOURER, VENOMSPITTER, OPERATIVE

abilities.name: Acidic Spray
abilities.rules: Once per turning point, when this operative performs the Shoot action with its venom bolt (blast), after all attack dice have been resolved, each enemy operative that was hit by that attack (excluding the primary target) gains one of your Poison tokens (if it doesn’t already have one).

operatives.name: WARRIOR
operatives.description: Ravener Warriors are highly aggressive subterranean predators, capable of moving swiftly through the battlefield and engaging enemies with their formidable scything talons and rending claws.
operatives.keywords: RAVENER, TYRANID, GREAT DEVOURER, WARRIOR, OPERATIVE

abilities.name: Ravenous
abilities.rules: Once per turning point, when this operative incapacitates an enemy operative while fighting or retaliating, it regains D3+1 lost wounds.

operatives.name: WRECKER
operatives.description: Wreckers are particularly destructive Raveners, equipped with bone maces and crushing claws designed to tear through enemy fortifications and heavily armoured targets.
operatives.keywords: RAVENER, TYRANID, GREAT DEVOURER, WRECKER, OPERATIVE

abilities.name: Reinforced Carapace
abilities.rules: Normal and Critical Dmg of 4 or more inflicts 1 less damage on this operative.

actions.name: Devastating Charge
effects: • Perform a free Charge action with this operative. During that action, it can move through enemy operatives, and can leave their control range (it must still end the move following all requirements for that move). Then, after it moves, select one enemy operative within its control range and inflict D3+3 damage on it. If that enemy operative is within its control range when this operative is set up or emerges from underground, inflict 2D3+3 damage instead. You cannot perform this action if it would cause this operative to be incapacitated.
• This action can only be performed once per battle.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

operatives.name: TREMORSCYTHE
operatives.description: Tremorscythes are Raveners capable of causing localized seismic disturbances, disrupting enemy movement and allowing their broodmates to gain tactical advantages.
operatives.keywords: RAVENER, TYRANID, GREAT DEVOURER, TREMORSCYTHE, OPERATIVE

abilities.name: Subterranean Ambush
abilities.rules: Once per turning point, after an enemy operative performs an action in which it moves more than 2" and ends within 2" of your TUNNEL, if this operative is underground and is either ready or hasn't counteracted during this turning point, you can interrupt that enemy operative's activation/counteraction to use this rule. If you do, activate or counteract with this operative (as appropriate), but during its activation/counteraction it must fight against or shoot against that enemy operative, and cannot do so against any other enemy operatives until it does (if this isn't possible, this operative's activation/counteraction is cancelled and this rule hasn't been used). After completing this operative's action/counteraction, continue that enemy operative's activation/counteraction (if possible).

abilities.name: Hypersensory Hunter
abilities.rules: This operative can perform the Charge action while it has a Conceal order if it performed the Burrow action during the same activation/counteraction.

actions.name: Seismic Blast
effects: • PSYCHIC. Select one enemy operative visible to and within 6" of this operative. Inflict D3+2 damage on that enemy operative and it becomes Stunned. If that enemy operative is within 2" of your TUNNEL, inflict 2D3+2 damage instead.
• This action can only be performed once per turning point.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

strategy_ploys.name: UNEARTHLY AGILITY
strategy_ploys.description: Raveners display unnatural speed and grace, darting across the battlefield to engage and disengage at will.
strategy_ploys.rules: Whenever a friendly RAVENER operative performs the Dash, Charge, Fall Back, or Reposition action, it can move an additional 1" for that action. If it is UNDERGROUND, it can move an additional 2" instead.

strategy_ploys.name: AMBUSH PREDATORS
strategy_ploys.description: Raveners excel at ambushing foes from unexpected angles, using their subterranean abilities to gain a decisive advantage.
strategy_ploys.rules: Whenever a friendly RAVENER operative emerges from underground, it can immediately perform a free Charge action. If it does so, its melee weapons have the Lethal 5+ weapon rule for that action.

strategy_ploys.name: HIVE MIND DIRECTIVES
strategy_ploys.description: The Raveners are guided by the pervasive will of the Hive Mind, allowing for perfect coordination in their deadly hunts.
strategy_ploys.rules: Once per turning point, select two friendly RAVENER operatives. You can change the order of both operatives. Then, one of them can immediately perform a free Dash action, and the other can immediately perform a free Shoot or Fight action.

firefight_ploys.name: VENOMOUS STRIKE
firefight_ploys.description: The Raveners' attacks are imbued with potent neurotoxins that debilitate and slowly consume their victims.
firefight_ploys.rules: Use this firefight ploy when a friendly RAVENER operative is fighting or shooting with a Poison weapon. After all attack dice have been resolved, if at least one hit was resolved, the target gains one of your Poison tokens (if it doesn't already have one).

firefight_ploys.name: BURROW AND STRIKE
firefight_ploys.description: Raveners exploit their burrowing abilities to move unseen and strike from unexpected locations.
firefight_ploys.rules: Use this firefight ploy during a friendly RAVENER operative’s activation. That operative can perform the Burrow action for 1 less AP, and if it emerges from underground during that action, it can immediately perform a free Shoot or Fight action.

firefight_ploys.name: FLESH-RENDING ASSAULT
firefight_ploys.description: The Raveners' talons and claws are designed to tear through armour and flesh with horrific efficiency.
firefight_ploys.rules: Use this firefight ploy when a friendly RAVENER operative is fighting or retaliating. Until the end of that combat, its melee weapons gain the Piercing 1 weapon rule, and if they already have Piercing, their Piercing characteristic is increased by 1 (e.g., Piercing 1 becomes Piercing 2).

equipment.name: CHITINOUS PLATING
equipment.description: Reinforced chitinous plates provide additional protection against incoming attacks.
equipment.rules: Once per turning point, when an attack dice inflicts damage on a friendly RAVENER operative, you can ignore 1 damage inflicted from a normal hit or 2 damage from a critical hit. This can only be used once per operative per turning point.

equipment.name: BIO-ACID SPITTER
equipment.description: A living weapon capable of spewing corrosive bio-acid, melting through enemy armour and flesh.
equipment.rules: A friendly RAVENER WARRIOR operative can be equipped with this weapon. It cannot use this weapon if it has already performed a Charge action this activation.

equipment.name: SUBTERRANEAN SENSORS
equipment.description: Advanced bio-sensors allow Raveners to detect movement beneath the surface, anticipating enemy positions.
equipment.rules: Once per turning point, a friendly RAVENER operative that is underground can reveal the position of one enemy operative that is not underground. That enemy operative cannot be Obscured from friendly RAVENER operatives until the end of the turning point.

rules.name: POISON
rules.description: In the Resolve Attack Dice step, if you inflict damage with any critical successes, the operative this weapon is being used against gains one of your Poison tokens (if it doesn't already have one). Whenever an operative that has one of your poison tokens is activated, inflict D3 damage on it.
rules.rules: In the Resolve Attack Dice step, if you inflict damage with any critical successes, the operative this weapon is being used against gains one of your Poison tokens (if it doesn't already have one). Whenever an operative that has one of your Poison tokens is activated, inflict D3 damage on it.

rules.name: BURROW
rules.description: When setting up a RAVENER kill team before the battle, your first two operatives must be set up as normal. Each other friendly RAVENER operative thereafter can be set up UNDERGROUND: place it to one side instead of in the killzone. In the Firefight phase, friendly RAVENER operatives set up UNDERGROUND are activated and can counteract as normal. Whenever a friendly RAVENER operative is UNDERGROUND, it cannot perform any actions other than Burrow. At the end of the battle, each friendly RAVENER operative that's UNDERGROUND is incapacitated. Friendly RAVENER operatives can perform the Burrow unique action.

actions.name: BURROW
effects: • If this operative is UNDERGROUND, set it up on the killzone floor wholly within 2" of your TUNNEL, not within control range of enemy operatives. It is no longer UNDERGROUND.
• If this operative is not UNDERGROUND, remove it from the killzone and set it up UNDERGROUND. It is no longer in the killzone.

rules.rules: When setting up a RAVENER kill team before the battle, your first two operatives must be set up as normal. Each other friendly RAVENER operative thereafter can be set up UNDERGROUND: place it to one side instead of in the killzone. In the Firefight phase, friendly RAVENER operatives set up UNDERGROUND are activated and can counteract as normal. Whenever a friendly RAVENER operative is UNDERGROUND, it cannot perform any actions other than Burrow. At the end of the battle, each friendly RAVENER operative that's UNDERGROUND is incapacitated. Friendly RAVENER operatives can perform the Burrow unique action.

rules.name: TUNNEL
rules.description: At the end of the Set Up Operatives step, place your Tunnel marker number '0' on the killzone floor, wholly within your drop zone and touching your killzone edge. As a STRATEGIC GAMBIT in the first four turning points, you can place your next numbered Tunnel marker on the killzone floor wholly within 5" of your preceding Tunnel marker (in Killzone: Gallowdark, this distance can be measured through walls). This means that, as the battle progresses, you can have a series of sequentially numbered Tunnel markers (0, 1, 2, 3 and 4). Once you have placed five tunnel markers, don't place any more (i.e. if your battle lasts more than four turning points). Your Tunnel markers and the area between your sequentially numbered markers (i.e. between 0 and 1, 1 and 2, etc.), create your TUNNEL. In a killzone that uses the hazardous area rules (e.g. Killzone Bheta Decima), for the purposes of the Restricted Movement rule, parts of a Tunnel marker that are touching a hazardous area are treated as a hazardous area.
rules.rules: At the end of the Set Up Operatives step, place your Tunnel marker number '0' on the killzone floor, wholly within your drop zone and touching your killzone edge. As a STRATEGIC GAMBIT in the first four turning points, you can place your next numbered Tunnel marker on the killzone floor wholly within 5" of your preceding Tunnel marker (in Killzone: Gallowdark, this distance can be measured through walls). This means that, as the battle progresses, you can have a series of sequentially numbered Tunnel markers (0, 1, 2, 3 and 4). Once you have placed five tunnel markers, don't place any more (i.e. if your battle lasts more than four turning points). Your Tunnel markers and the area between your sequentially numbered markers (i.e. between 0 and 1, 1 and 2, etc.), create your TUNNEL. In a killzone that uses the hazardous area rules (e.g. Killzone Bheta Decima), for the purposes of the Restricted Movement rule, parts of a Tunnel marker that are touching a hazardous area are treated as a hazardous area.

rules.name: PREDATORY INSTINCTS
rules.description: Raveners, driven by the primal predatory instincts of the Tyranid Hive Mind, exhibit relentless aggression and combat prowess.
rules.rules: During each friendly RAVENER operative's activation, it can perform two Fight actions. Each friendly RAVENER operative can counteract regardless of its order. Whenever it does: • You can change its order first, or change its order instead of performing an action (for the latter, still treat it as having counteracted this turning point). • During that counteraction, if it doesn't perform a mission action it can perform a free Burrow action.

selection.operatives: ↘ 1 SANCTIFIER CONFESSOR operative ↘ 1 SANCTIFIER CHERUB operative ↘ 9 SANCTIFIER operatives selected from the following list: • CONFLAGRATOR • DEATH CULT ASSASSIN • DRILL ABBOT • MIRACULIST • MISSIONARY with one of the following options: ○ Ministorum flamer; brazier of holy fire ○ Ministorum flamer; gun butt; holy relic • MISSIONARY with one of the following options: ○ Meltagun; chainsword; holy relic ○ Plasma gun; chainsword; brazier of holy fire • PERSECUTOR • PREACHER • RELIQUANT • SALVATIONIST Other than PREACHER operatives, your kill team can only include each operative above once. Your kill team can only include up to four PREACHER operatives. You cannot select an option that includes a brazier of holy fire more than once per battle. [3, 4]

operatives.name: CONFESSOR
operatives.description: The Confessor leads their Kill Team into battle, inspiring their sisters to unleash brutal displays of zeal upon the enemies of the Imperium. [3]
operatives.keywords: SANCTIFIER, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS MINISTORUM, LEADER, CONFESSOR

weapons.name: TWIN HAND FLAMERS
weapons.rules: Range 6", Saturate, Torrent 2", Blaze•, Twin Torrent¹•

abilities.name: Twin Torrent¹
abilities.rules: Select up to two valid targets. Shoot with this weapon against both of them in an order of your choice (roll each sequence separately). Torrent 0" means you cannot select secondary targets, but this weapon still has the Torrent weapon rule for all other rules purposes, e.g. the Condensed Stronghold rule (see Killzone: Volkus, Kill Team Core Book). [5]

abilities.name: Lead the Procession
abilities.rules: In each turning point after the first, whenever this operative is an ORATOR and performs the Charge, Fall Back, or Reposition action during its activation, you can use this rule before it moves. If you do, determine each other friendly SANCTIFIER operative that's benefitting from the SERMON. After this operative ends that action, each of those friendly SANCTIFIER operatives can immediately perform a free Charge, Fall Back, or Reposition action in an order of your choice, but each must end that move in a location where they are still benefitting from the SERMON. If this operative is incapacitated before this rule is fully resolved, e.g. from the Guard action’s interruption, don’t remove it from the killzone until this rule has been resolved. [6, 7]

abilities.name: Commanding Declamation
abilities.rules: Whenever the enemy operative would perform an action during an activation or counteraction while visible to and within 6" of this operative, you can use this rule. If you do, roll one D6: if the result is higher than that enemy operative's APL stat: • It cannot perform that action during that activation or counteraction (the AP spent on it isn't refunded). If it's a counteraction, that counteraction ends. • You cannot use this rule again during the battle.

operatives.name: CHERUB
operatives.description: Cherubs are servile familiars that assist their masters in battle. [8]
operatives.keywords: SANCTIFIER, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS MINISTORUM, CHERUB [8]

abilities.name: Restricted Actions
abilities.rules: This operative cannot use any weapons that aren’t on its datacard, or perform unique actions other than Incentivise. [8]

abilities.name: Cherub
abilities.rules: • Whenever determining control of an objective marker, treat this operative's APL stat as 1 lower. • Whenever this operative has a Conceal order and is in cover, it cannot be selected as a valid target, taking precedence over all other rules (e.g. Seek, Vantage terrain). • This operative cannot use any weapons that aren’t on its datacard, or perform unique actions other than Incentivise.

abilities.name: Fly
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative performs the Charge, Fall Back, or Reposition action, it can FLY. If it does, don't move it. Instead, remove it from the killzone and set it back up wholly within a distance equal to its Move stat of its original location, measuring the horizontal distance only (in a killzone that uses the close quarters rules, e.g. Killzone: Gallowdark, this distance cannot be measured over or through Wall terrain). Note that it gains no additional distance when performing the Charge action. It must be set up in a location it can be placed, and unless it's the Charge action, it cannot be set up within control range of an enemy operative.

actions.name: INCENTIVISE
actions.rules: SUPPORT. Select one other friendly SANCTIFIER operative (excluding CONFESSOR, DEATH CULT ASSASSIN, MIRACULIST and ORATOR) visible to and within 2" of this operative. Until the end of that operative’s next activation, add 1 to its APL stat. [6]
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative. [6]

operatives.name: CONFLAGRATOR
operatives.description: Conflagrators are masters of close-range purification, wielding heavy flamers to cleanse foes and obstacles alike.
operatives.keywords: SANCTIFIER, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS MINISTORUM, CONFLAGRATOR

weapons.name: TWIN HAND FLAMERS (FOCUSED)
weapons.rules: Range 6", Saturate, Torrent 2", Blaze•, Twin Torrent•

weapons.name: TWIN HAND FLAMERS (TWIN TORRENT)
weapons.rules: Range 6", Saturate, Torrent 0"•, Twin Torrent•, Blaze•

abilities.name: Sanctification Rack
abilities.rules: This operative can perform the Sanctification Orb action. Doing so in this manner doesn't count towards the once per turning point limit (i.e. if you also select that equipment for other operatives).

operatives.name: DEATH CULT ASSASSIN
operatives.description: For a Death Cult Executioner, the act of living is a blasphemy only balanced by the tally of souls they reap. They deliver death up close and master numerous combat styles. [9] (Note: description refers to Elucidian Starstriders' Death Cult Executioner, as no specific description was given for SANCTIFIER’s Death Cult Assassin. Synthesized for context.)
operatives.keywords: SANCTIFIER, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS MINISTORUM, DEATH CULT ASSASSIN [10]

abilities.name: Bladed Stance
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is fighting or retaliating, you can resolve one of your successes before the normal order. If you do, that success must be used to block. [8]

actions.name: TRAINED ASSASSIN
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative. [10]

operatives.name: DRILL ABBOT
operatives.description: Drill Abbots are unwavering enforcers of discipline, their presence inspiring their comrades to fight with renewed vigour.
operatives.keywords: SANCTIFIER, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS MINISTORUM, DRILL ABBOT

abilities.name: Schola Progenium Disciplinarian
abilities.rules: Whenever a friendly SANCTIFIER operative is within 6" of this operative, you can ignore any changes to that operative's stats from being injured (including its weapons' stats).

abilities.name: Null Skull
abilities.rules: Whenever an enemy operative is within 6" of this operative, that enemy operative's APL stat cannot be added to (remove all positive APL changes it has). If an enemy operative that's more than 6" from this operative has a positive APL stat change and your opponent spends its final AP to move that operative within 6" of this operative, this can cause your opponent to have spent more AP than its APL stat - this is permitted in this situation.

operatives.name: MIRACULIST
operatives.description: Miraculists are able to manifest incredible feats of faith, turning aside blows and inspiring their sisters to endure impossible odds.
operatives.keywords: SANCTIFIER, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS MINISTORUM, MIRACULIST

abilities.name: Miracle
abilities.rules: The first time this operative would be incapacitated during the battle, it's not incapacitated, has 1 wound remaining and cannot be incapacitated for the remainder of the action. All remaining attack dice are discarded (including yours if this operative is fighting or retaliating), then this operative can immediately perform a free Dash or Fall Back action (for the latter, it cannot move more than 3"), even if it's performed an action that prevents it from performing the Dash or Fall Back action.

operatives.name: MISSIONARY
operatives.keywords: SANCTIFIER, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS MINISTORUM, MISSIONARY

abilities.name: Cult Icon
abilities.rules: Whenever determining control of a marker within 6" of this operative, treat the total APL stat of friendly SANCTIFIER operatives that contest it as 1 higher if at least one friendly SANCTIFIER operative contests that marker. Note this isn’t a change to the APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this. [12]

operatives.name: RELIQUANT
operatives.keywords: SANCTIFIER, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS MINISTORUM, RELIQUARIUS

abilities.name: Icon Bearer
abilities.rules: Whenever determining control of a marker, treat this operative’s APL stat as 1 higher. Note this isn’t a change to its APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this.

actions.name: Raise Icon
effects: ↘ You gain 1 Faith point. If this operative controls an objective marker, you also gain a number of Faith points equal to the turning point number.
conditions: This operative can only perform this action once per turning point, and cannot perform it while within control range of an enemy operative.

operatives.name: PREACHER
operatives.description: Preachers exhort their comrades with fiery rhetoric, inspiring them to greater acts of devotion and defence. [13]
operatives.keywords: SANCTIFIER, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS MINISTORUM, PREACHER [13]

abilities.name: Defend the Faith
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative contests an objective marker, it's benefitting from the SERMON. [13]

operatives.name: PERSECUTOR
operatives.description: Persecutors are fervent close-combat specialists, wielding powerful melee weapons and flamers to purge the Emperor's foes.
operatives.keywords: SANCTIFIER, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS MINISTORUM, PERSECUTOR [5]

abilities.name: Merciless Castigation
abilities.rules: The first time this operative performs the Fight action during each of its activations, if neither it nor the enemy operative in that sequence is incapacitated, this operative can immediately perform a free Fight action afterwards, but you cannot select any other enemy operative to fight against during that action (and only if it’s still valid to fight against). This takes precedence over action restrictions. [10]

abilities.name: Fanatical Retribution
abilities.rules: If this operative is incapacitated during the Fight action, you can strike with one of your unresolved successes before it's removed from the killzone. [5]

operatives.name: MISSIONARY
operatives.keywords: SANCTIFIER, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS MINISTORUM, MISSIONARY

operatives.name: SALVATIONIST
operatives.keywords: SANCTIFIER, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS MINISTORUM, SALVATIONIST

abilities.name: Conversion Field
abilities.rules: Whenever an operative more than 6" from this operative is shooting a friendly SANCTIFIER operative within 6" of this operative, improve that friendly operative's Save stat by 1 and worsen the x of the Piercing weapon rule by 1 (if any). Note that Piercing 1 with therefore be ignored.

actions.name: MEDIKIT
effects: ↘ Select one friendly SANCTIFIER operative within this operative's control range to regain 2D3 lost wounds.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

operatives.name: MILITANT
operatives.keywords: SANCTIFIER, IMPERIUM, ADEPTA SORORITAS, MILITANT

abilities.name: Militant Faith
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is shooting, fighting or retaliating, if you use an ACT OF FAITH during that sequence and an enemy operative is incapacitated, the Faith points spent on that ACT OF FAITH are refunded. If you use the Icon of Faith equipment, Faith points are only refunded for one of those ACTS OF FAITH (your choice).

operatives.name: HOSPITALLER
operatives.keywords: SANCTIFIER, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS MINISTORUM, MEDIC, HOSPITALLER

abilities.name: Medic!
abilities.rules: The first time during each turning point that another friendly NOVITIATE operative would be incapacitated while visible to and within 3" of this operative, you can use this rule, providing neither this nor that operative is within control range of an enemy operative. If you do, that friendly operative isn’t incapacitated and has 1 wound remaining and cannot be incapacitated for the remainder of the action. After that action, that friendly operative can immediately perform a free Dash action, but must end that move within this operative’s control range. Subtract 1 from this and that operative’s APL stats until the end of their next activations respectively, and if this rule was used during that friendly operative’s activation, that activation ends. You cannot use this rule if this operative is incapacitated, or if it's a Shoot action and this operative would be a primary or secondary target. [43]

actions.name: Chirurgeon's Tools
effects: ↘ Select one friendly NOVITIATE operative within this operative’s control range to regain up to 2D3 lost wounds. It cannot be an operative that the Medic! rule was used on during this turning point.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

strategy_ploys.name: UNWAVERING DEVOTION
strategy_ploys.description: SANCTIFIERS fight with unwavering resolve, their faith shielding them from harm.
strategy_ploys.rules: Whenever a friendly SANCTIFIER operative is shooting, fighting or retaliating, after you roll your attack dice. If it’s the Shoot action, that other operative is only in cover or obscured if the original target was. [7]

strategy_ploys.name: DEFENDERS OF THE FAITH
strategy_ploys.description: The NOVITIATES fight with renewed ferocity to defend their objectives.
strategy_ploys.rules: Whenever an operative is shooting against, fighting against or retaliating against a friendly NOVITIATE operative that contests an objective marker or one of your mission markers, in the Resolve Attack Dice step of that sequence, you can halve the damage inflicted (rounding up and to a minimum of 2) on that friendly operative from one normal success. [50]

strategy_ploys.name: BLESSED REJUVENATION
strategy_ploys.description: Through their faith, the NOVITIATES are able to mend their wounds.
strategy_ploys.rules: Whenever you spend Faith points, at the end of that action, the friendly operative you spent them on can regain up to D3 lost wounds. [50]

firefight_ploys.name: GLORIOUS MARTYRDOM
firefight_ploys.description: Upon being incapacitated, a SANCTIFIER’s final moments can ignite a furious counter-attack from their comrades. [19]
firefight_ploys.rules: Use this firefight ploy when a friendly NOVITIATE operative is incapacitated, before it’s removed from the killzone. [19]

equipment.name: PURITY SEALS
equipment.description: Affixed to clothing, armour and wargear by way of wax seals, these pieces of parchment are inscribed with holy prayers and blessings. [20]
equipment.rules: Once per turning point, when a friendly SANCTIFIER operative is shooting or fighting, if you roll two or more fails, you can discard one of them to retain another as a normal success instead. [20]

equipment.name: ICON OF FAITH
equipment.rules: Once per turning point, you can use up to two ACTS OF FAITH during a sequence, but each one must be different. This takes precedence over the normal ACTS OF FAITH rules.

equipment.name: SANCTIFIED ROUNDS
equipment.rules: Whenever a friendly NOVITIATE operative is shooting with an autogun, autopistol, relic bolt pistol or relic boltgun, if you spend a Faith point, that weapon has the Piercing Crits 1 weapon rule until the end of that sequence

equipment.name: AUTO-CHASTISERS
equipment.rules: Once per turning point, when a friendly NOVITIATE operative is shooting, fighting or retaliating, in the Roll Attack Dice step, you can inflict 1-3 damage on that friendly operative (but not enough to incapacitate it). If you do, you can use one ACT OF FAITH for free during that sequence with a Faith points cost no more than the damage you inflicted from this rule.

equipment.name: HOLY EMBROCATIONS
equipment.rules: You can ignore any changes to the Move stat of friendly NOVITIATE operatives from being injured.

rules.name: SERMON
rules.description: The spiritual guidance of key operatives grants benefits to nearby allies. [6, 13]
rules.rules: Referenced by operative abilities. Not explicitly detailed as a standalone faction rule in provided sources.

rules.name: UNWAVERING FAITH
rules.description: SANCTIFIERS remain steadfast even when injured. [10]
rules.rules: You can ignore any changes to the Move stat of friendly NOVITIATE operatives from being injured. [21]

rules.name: BLAZE
rules.description: If you retain any critical successes, the operative this weapon is being used against gains one of your Blaze tokens (if it doesn't already have one). Whenever an operative that has one of your Blaze tokens is activated, inflict D3 damage on it. Then that operative's controlling player selects one of the following: • Roll one D6: on a 3+, remove that token. • Subtract 1 from the operative's APL stat until the end of that activation to remove that token.
rules.rules: If you retain any critical successes, the operative this weapon is being used against gains one of your Blaze tokens (if it doesn't already have one). Whenever an operative that has one of your Blaze tokens is activated, inflict D3 damage on it. Then that operative's controlling player selects one of the following: • Roll one D6: on a 3+, remove that token. • Subtract 1 from the operative's APL stat until the end of that activation to remove that token.

rules.name: MINISTORUM SERMON
rules.description: STRATEGIC GAMBIT. Select one friendly SACTIFIER operative. If a friendly CONFESSOR operative hasn't been incapacitated, you must select it. Until you use this STRATEGIC GAMBIT again during the battle, that operative has the ORATOR keyword. Whenever a friendly SANCTIFIER operative is within 3" of a friendly ORATOR operative (or 6" if the ORATOR is a CONFESSOR), that friendly SANCTIFIER operative is benefitting from the SERMON. Whenever a friendly SANCTIFIER operative is activated within 3" of a friendly ORATOR operative (or 6" if the ORATOR is a CONFESSOR), that friendly SANCTIFIER operative is benefitting from the SERMON until the end of that activation (i.e. even if it then moves more than the distance requirement from the ORATOR operative). Whenever a friendly SANCTIFIER operative is benefitting from the SERMON, Normal and Critical Dmg of 3 or more inflicts 1 less damage on it.
rules.rules: STRATEGIC GAMBIT. Select one friendly SACTIFIER operative. If a friendly CONFESSOR operative hasn't been incapacitated, you must select it. Until you use this STRATEGIC GAMBIT again during the battle, that operative has the ORATOR keyword. Whenever a friendly SANCTIFIER operative is within 3" of a friendly ORATOR operative (or 6" if the ORATOR is a CONFESSOR), that friendly SANCTIFIER operative is benefitting from the SERMON. Whenever a friendly SANCTIFIER operative is activated within 3" of a friendly ORATOR operative (or 6" if the ORATOR is a CONFESSOR), that friendly SANCTIFIER operative is benefitting from the SERMON until the end of that activation (i.e. even if it then moves more than the distance requirement from the ORATOR operative). Whenever a friendly SANCTIFIER operative is benefitting from the SERMON, Normal and Critical Dmg of 3 or more inflicts 1 less damage on it.

rules.name: ACT OF FAITH
rules.description: NOVITIATES harness their fervent faith to perform miraculous acts on the battlefield. [48, 50, 52, 53]
rules.rules: In the Ready step of each Strategy phase, you gain a number of Faith points equal to half the number of friendly NOVITIATE operatives that haven’t been incapacitated (rounding up). Whenever a friendly NOVITIATE operative is shooting, fighting or retaliating, or an operative is shooting it, in the Roll Attack Dice (or Roll Defence Dice step if an operative is shooting it), you can spend your Faith points to use one ACT OF FAITH. You cannot use more than one ACT OF FAITH per sequence, and their costs and effects are as follows: GUIDANCE • 1 FAITH POINT • You can re-roll one of your dice. BLESSING • 2 FAITH POINTS • You can retain one of your normal successes as a critical success instead. INTERVENTION • 3 FAITH POINTS • You can retain one of your fails as a normal success instead of discarding it.

selection.operatives: ↘ 1 SCOUT SQUAD SERGEANT operative with one of the following options: ○ Astartes shotgun; fists ○ Boltgun; fists ○ Bolt pistol; chainsword ↘ 8 SCOUT SQUAD operatives selected from the following list: • HEAVY GUNNER with fists, bolt pistol and heavy bolter • HEAVY GUNNER with fists, bolt pistol and missile launcher • HUNTER • SNIPER • TRACKER • WARRIOR with one of the following options: ○ Astartes shotgun; fists ○ Boltgun; fists ○ Bolt pistol; combat blade Other than WARRIOR operatives, your kill team can only include each operative on this list once. [22]

operatives.name: SCOUT SERGEANT
operatives.description: The Sergeant is an experienced leader, guiding their SCOUT SQUAD in the field. [23]
operatives.keywords: Leader, IMPERIUM, SCOUT SQUAD, ADEPTUS ASTARTES, SERGEANT

abilities.name: Guidance and Experience
abilities.rules: Once during each of this operative’s activations, you can select one other friendly SCOUT SQUAD operative visible to it. Until the end of that operative’s next activation, add 1 to its APL stat.

abilities.name: Astartes
abilities.rules: During this operative’s activation, it can perform either two Shoot actions or two Fight actions. If it’s two Shoot actions, an Astartes shotgun, bolt pistol or boltgun must be selected for at least one of them. This operative can counteract regardless of its order. [23]

abilities.name: Grapnel Launcher
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is climbing up, you can treat the vertical distance as 2" (regardless of how far the operative actually moves vertically). [23]

operatives.name: SCOUT HEAVY GUNNER
operatives.keywords: SCOUT SQUAD, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS ASTARTES, Heavy Gunner

operatives.name: SCOUT HUNTER
operatives.keywords: SCOUT SQUAD, ADEPTUS ASTARTES, HUNTER

abilities.name: Grapnel Launcher
