abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is climbing up, you can treat the vertical distance as 2" (regardless of how far the operative actually moves vertically). [23]

abilities.name: Camo Cloak
abilities.rules: Whenever an operative is shooting this operative: Ignore the Saturate weapon rule. If you can retain any cover saves, you can retain one additional cover save, or you can retain one cover save as a critical success instead. This isn’t cumulative with improved cover saves from Vantage terrain.

operatives.name: SCOUT SNIPER
operatives.keywords: SCOUT SQUAD, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS ASTARTES, Sniper

abilities.name: Camo Cloak
abilities.rules: Whenever an operative is shooting this operative: • Ignore the Saturate weapon rule. • If you can retain any cover saves, you can retain one additional cover save, or you can retain one cover save as a critical success instead. This isn’t cumulative with improved cover saves from Vantage terrain.

actions.name: Optics (AP1)
effects: ↘ Until the start of this operative’s next activation, whenever it’s shooting, enemy operatives cannot be obscured.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

operatives.name: SCOUT TRACKER
operatives.description: Trackers carry highly powerful auspexes • scanners capable of analysing the battlefield, identifying targets or rapidly planning deadly ambushes. [24]
operatives.keywords: SCOUT SQUAD, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS ASTARTES, TRACKER

abilities.name: Auspex
abilities.rules: Once per turning point, when a friendly SCOUT SQUAD operative performs the Shoot action and you’re selecting a valid target, you can use this rule. If you do, until the end of the activation/counteraction, enemy operatives within 8" of that friendly operative cannot be obscured. If that friendly operative is a SNIPER, its ranged weapons also have the Seek Light weapon rule.

operatives.name: SCOUT WARRIOR
operatives.description: Scout Warriors are skilled fighters, committed to their squad and determined to ascend to full battle-brother status. [24]
operatives.keywords: SCOUT SQUAD, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS ASTARTES, WARRIOR

abilities.name: Scout Warrior
abilities.rules: You can do each of the following once per turning point: • One friendly SCOUT SQUAD WARRIOR operative can perform the Smoke Grenade action. • One friendly SCOUT SQUAD WARRIOR operative can perform the Stun Grenade action. The rules for these actions are found in universal equipment. Performing these actions using this rule doesn’t count towards their action limits (i.e. if you also select those grenades from equipment). [25, 26]

strategy_ploys.name: FORWARD SCOUTING
strategy_ploys.description: At the end of the Set Up Operatives step, you can select and resolve up to six Forward Scouting options. Each option has a number in brackets, which is the maximum number of times you can select and resolve it for the battle. For example, your five selections could be Reposition (2), Trip Alarm (1), Booby Trap (1) and Diversion (1). If both players have this rule, alternate resolving selection by selection, starting with the player that has initiative. [30]
strategy_ploys.rules: At the end of the Set Up Operatives step, you can select and resolve up to six Forward Scouting options. Each option has a number in brackets, which is the maximum number of times you can select and resolve it for the battle. For example, your five selections could be Reposition (2), Trip Alarm (1), Booby Trap (1) and Diversion (1). If both players have this rule, alternate resolving selection by selection, starting with the player that has initiative.

strategy_ploys.name: STALKING THE FOE
strategy_ploys.description: Scouts use their stealth and keen senses to track their prey. [27]
strategy_ploys.rules: Whenever a friendly SCOUT SQUAD TRACKER or SCOUT SQUAD HUNTER operative is shooting against an operative that is more than 6" from it, its ranged weapons have the Lethal 5+ weapon rule.

strategy_ploys.name: GUERRILLA WARFARE
strategy_ploys.description: Scouts excel at operating behind enemy lines, launching surprise attacks and withdrawing before the foe can react. [27]
strategy_ploys.rules: Each friendly SCOUT SQUAD operative can perform the Fall Back action for 1 less AP.

firefight_ploys.name: EMBOLDENED ASPIRANT
firefight_ploys.description: SCOUT SQUADs are emboldened by the prospect of proving themselves in battle.
firefight_ploys.rules: Whenever a friendly SCOUT SQUAD operative is fighting or retaliating, if it has a higher Wounds stat than that friendly SCOUT SQUAD operative, you can change one of your retained normal successes to a critical success instead. Any rules that take effect as a result of retaining a critical success (e.g. Devastating, Piercing Crits, etc.) still do. [27]

firefight_ploys.name: COVERT POSITION
firefight_ploys.description: Scouts use their superior stealth training to remain hidden from enemy sight.
firefight_ploys.rules: Until the start of its next activation, while that operative has a Conceal order and is in cover, it cannot be selected as a valid target, taking precedence over all other rules (e.g. Seek, Vantage terrain) except being within 2". [28]

equipment.name: COMBAT BLADE
equipment.description: These simple but effective blades are carried by SCOUT SQUAD operatives for close-quarters engagements.
equipment.rules: Friendly SCOUT SQUAD operatives have the following melee weapon. Note that some operatives already have this weapon but with better stats; in that instance, use the better version. NAME ATK HIT DMG Combat blade 3 3+ 4/5 Friendly SCOUT SQUAD HUNTER and SCOUT SQUAD WARRIOR operatives that already have a combat blade (but with different stats) have the following melee weapon instead: NAME ATK HIT DMG Combat knife 4 3+ 4/5 [29]

equipment.name: FRAG GRENADE
equipment.description: Standard fragmentation grenades used by SCOUT SQUAD operatives.
equipment.rules: Range 6", Blast 2", Limited 1

equipment.name: KRAK GRENADE
equipment.description: Anti-armour krak grenades used by SCOUT SQUAD operatives.
equipment.rules: Range 6", Limited 1, Piercing 1

equipment.name: AUSPEX
equipment.description: A handheld scanner used by SCOUT SQUAD operatives for reconnaissance.
equipment.rules: Once per turning point, when a friendly SCOUT SQUAD operative performs the Shoot action and you’re selecting a valid target, you can use this rule. If you do, until the end of the activation/counteraction, enemy operatives within 8" of that friendly operative cannot be obscured.

rules.name: ASTARTES
rules.description: Space Marines are genetically modified superhumans made for one purpose: war. [23]
rules.rules: During each friendly SCOUT SQUAD operative’s activation, it can perform either two Shoot actions or two Fight actions. If it’s two Shoot actions, an Astartes shotgun, bolt pistol or boltgun must be selected for at least one of them. This operative can counteract regardless of its order. [23]

rules.name: FORWARD SCOUTING
rules.description: Central to the role of Space Marine Scouts is ranging ahead of the strike force they are attached to, spending extensive periods laying traps for the foe, harassing enemy patrols, gathering intelligence and reconnoitring the ground in preparation for the Chapter’s assault force. [30]
rules.rules: At the end of the Set Up Operatives step, you can select and resolve up to six Forward Scouting options. Redeploy (1) Change the set up of one third of your operatives (rounding up). Reposition (2) Perform a free Reposition action with one friendly operative that’s wholly within your drop zone. It must end that move wholly within 3" of your drop zone. [26, 28]

name: TEMPESTUS AQUILONS
description: Tempestus Aquilons are an elite tactical shooting kill team of the Imperium, renowned for their unparalleled ability to descend into the killzone mid-battle. Composed of highly disciplined specialists, they excel at rapid engagements, providing precise fire support and seizing objectives with shock and awe tactics.

selection.operatives: ↘ 1 TEMPESTUS AQUILON TEMPESTOR operative with one of the following options: ○ Hot‑shot laspistol; power weapon ○ Relic bolt pistol; chainsword ○ Hot‑shot lascarbine; fists ↘ 1 TEMPESTUS AQUILON SERVO‑SENTRY with one of the following options: ○ Flamer ○ Grenade launcher ○ Hot‑shot volley gun ↘ 9 TEMPESTUS AQUILON operatives selected from the following list: • GRENADIER • GUNFIGHTER • GUNNER with melta carbine and fists • GUNNER with plasma carbine and fists • MARKSMAN • PRECURSOR • TROOPER Other than TROOPER operatives, your kill team can only include each operative on this list once.

operatives.name: TEMPESTOR
operatives.description: A Tempestor leads their kill team into the thick of battle, possessing the tactical and strategic nous to direct their squad’s efforts.
operatives.keywords: TEMPESTUS AQUILON, Imperium, Tempestor, Leader

abilities.name: Salvo•
abilities.rules: Select up to two valid targets. Shoot with this weapon against both of them in an order of your choice (roll each sequence separately).

abilities.name: Gunfight
abilities.rules: Whenever an enemy operative within 8" of this operative shoots this operative, keep track of each attack dice that’s discarded as a fail. After the action, before incapacitated operatives are removed (including this one, if relevant), this operative can perform a free **Shoot** action (you can change its order to Engage to do so), but it can only target that enemy operative with its hot‑shot laspistols (focused), and you only roll a number of attack dice equal to the opponent’s discarded attack dice plus one (to a maximum of four).

abilities.name: Tempestus Veteran
abilities.rules: Once per battle, you can either use a firefight ploy for 0CP if this is the specified TEMPESTUS AQUILON operative, or the Command Re-roll firefight ploy for 0CP if this is the operative the attack or defence dice was rolled for.

actions.name: Command
effects: • **SUPPORT**. Select one other friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON operative (excluding **SERVO-SENTRY**) visible to and within 6" of this operative. Until the end of that operative's next activation, add 1 to its APL stat.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

operatives.name: GRENADIER
operatives.description: Aquilon Grenadiers specialise in the expert deployment of explosive ordinances.
operatives.keywords: TEMPESTUS AQUILON, Imperium, Grenadier

abilities.name: Grenadier
abilities.rules: This operative can use frag, krak, smoke and stun grenades (see universal equipment). Doing so doesn’t count towards any **Limited** uses you have (i.e. if you also select those grenades from equipment for other operatives). Whenever this operative is using a frag or krak grenade, improve the Hit stat of that weapon by 1.

abilities.name: Grenadier
abilities.rules: This operative can use frag, krak, smoke, and stun grenades (see universal equipment). Doing so doesn't count towards any **Limited** uses you have (i.e. if you also select those grenades from equipment for other operatives). Whenever this operative is using a frag or krak grenade, improve the Hit stat of that weapon by 1.

operatives.name: MARKSMAN
operatives.description: Aquilon Marksmen are expert snipers, providing precision fire support from advantageous positions.
operatives.keywords: TEMPESTUS AQUILON, Imperium, Marksman

abilities.name: Concealed Position•
abilities.rules: This operative can only use this weapon the first time it’s performing the **Shoot** action during the battle.

operatives.name: SERVO‑SENTRY
operatives.description: A servo‑sentry is a combat mechanoid that drops via grav‑impeller motors and provides Aquilon kill teams with fire support.
operatives.keywords: AQUILON, Servo‑sentry, Imperium

abilities.name: Machine
abilities.rules: This operative cannot be activated or perform actions if it’s within control range of an enemy operative, or if a friendly IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER SURVEYOR operative has been incapacitated. The turning point can end even if this operative is still ready. This operative cannot perform any actions other than **Charge**, **Dash**, **Fall Back**, **Reposition** and **Spot**. It cannot retaliate, assist in a fight, climb or jump.

abilities.name: Turret
abilities.rules: This operative can perform two **Shoot** actions during its activation.

abilities.name: Machine
abilities.rules: This operative cannot perform any actions other than Dash, Fall Back, Reposition and Shoot. It cannot retaliate, assist in a fight or use any weapons that aren’t on its datacard.

abilities.name: Turret
abilities.rules: This operative can perform two Shoot actions during its activation.

operatives.name: GUNNER
operatives.description: Aquilon Gunners wield powerful melta and plasma carbines to bring down elite foes and armoured targets.
operatives.keywords: TEMPESTUS AQUILON, Imperium, Gunner

operatives.name: PRECURSOR
operatives.description: Precursors are agile close-combat operatives, punishing complacent enemies with their swift and **Brutal** attacks.
operatives.keywords: TEMPESTUS AQUILON, Imperium, Precursor

abilities.name: Vicious Knife Fighter
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is fighting, after resolving your first attack dice during that sequence, you can immediately resolve another (before your opponent).

abilities.name: Dynamic
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative performs the **Shoot** or **Fight** action, it can immediately perform a free **Dash** action afterwards. It can do so even if it’s performed the **Charge** action during this activation, but can only use any remaining move distance it had from that **Charge** action (to a maximum of 3").

operatives.name: TROOPER
operatives.description: Tempestus Aquilon Troopers are rigorously trained warriors, clad in resilient carapace armour and wielding powerful hot-shot lascarbines.
operatives.keywords: TEMPESTUS AQUILON, Imperium, Trooper

abilities.name: Rapid Insertion
abilities.rules: **STRATEGIC GAMBIT** in the first Strategy phase. Each friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON TROOPER operative wholly within your drop zone can immediately perform a free **Reposition** action, but must finish that action wholly within 3" of your drop zone.

abilities.name: Swift Landing
abilities.rules: When this operative lands, you can set it up within 4" of one of your Drop markers (measuring horizontal distance only), taking precedence over the normal distance requirement.

strategy_ploys.name: SUDDEN OFFENSIVE
strategy_ploys.description: Tempestus Aquilons are skilled at dropping swiftly into combat and catching their enemies unawares.
strategy_ploys.rules: Count the number of friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON operatives that aren’t incapacitated, then halve the result (rounding up) to give you x. Until the end of their activation, friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON operatives’ weapons have the Balanced weapon rule if they are the first friendly operatives activated this turning point equal to x. For example, if you have five operatives, the first three friendly operatives activated will benefit.

strategy_ploys.name: EYE ABOVE
strategy_ploys.description: Airborne servo‑skulls and spotter aircraft keep the Aquilons appraised of up‑to‑the‑minute tactical data.
strategy_ploys.rules: Not detailed in provided sources.

strategy_ploys.name: DROP AND SECURE
strategy_ploys.description: Priority tactical objectives must be secured to ensure victory is absolute.
strategy_ploys.rules: Select one marker. • Until the Ready step of the next turning point, when determining control of that marker, treat the total APL stat of friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON operatives that contest it as 1 higher if at least one friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON operative contests that marker. Note this isn’t a change to the APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this. • Whenever a friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON operative is within 3" of that marker, add 1 to the Atk stat of its melee weapons (to a maximum of 4).

strategy_ploys.name: MAINTAIN MOMENTUM
strategy_ploys.description: Aquilons maintain their aggressive posture, pressing the attack against any ready foe.
strategy_ploys.rules: Whenever a friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON operative is shooting against or fighting against a ready enemy operative, that friendly operative’s weapons have the **Severe** weapon rule.

firefight_ploys.name: ADJUST COORDINATES
firefight_ploys.description: As the firefight flows and develops, so those Aquilons still descending adjust their trajectories in response.
firefight_ploys.rules: Use this firefight ploy when a friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON operative lands. You can set it up within 5" horizontally of one of your Drop markers, taking precedence over the normal distance requirement. It cannot perform the **Dash**, **Shoot** or **Fight** actions during this turning point.

firefight_ploys.name: HOT DROP
firefight_ploys.description: Aquilons land with blistering speed, delivering a devastating initial strike.
firefight_ploys.rules: Use this firefight ploy after rolling your attack dice for a friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON operative that either landed or dropped from Vantage terrain at least 2" higher than the killzone floor during this activation.

equipment.name: DROP AUGURY
equipment.description: This item provides intelligence from orbiting warships, allowing Aquilons to adjust their landing zones.
equipment.rules: Once per battle, when a friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON operative that’s set up above is activated, before expending or landing that operative, you can move one of your Drop markers again. However, it cannot be moved closer to your opponent’s drop zone.

rules.name: DROP INSERTION
rules.description: Tempestus Aquilons have an unparalleled ability to descend into the killzone mid-battle.
rules.rules: When setting up a TEMPESTUS AQUILON kill team before the battle, the first third of your kill team must be set up as normal. Each third thereafter can be set up above: place them to one side instead of in the killzone. For each third that’s set up above, you must set up the whole third in this way (not some of them), then place one of your Drop markers wholly within your drop zone. As a **STRATEGIC GAMBIT** in the first and second turning point, you can move your Drop markers up to 4", measuring the horizontal distance only. In a killzone that uses the close quarters rules (e.g. Killzone: Gallowdark), this can be measured and moved through Wall terrain. During the Firefight phase, friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON operatives set up above are activated as normal. When you do, you can either expend or land that operative. If it lands, set it up in the killzone in a location it can be placed as follows (it’s no longer set up above): • Within 3" of one of your Drop markers, measuring the horizontal distance only, or wholly within your drop zone. • Not within control range of enemy operatives (unless you’re setting up a **PRECURSOR** operative, which can be set up within control range of an enemy operative). • With no part of its base underneath Vantage terrain. • With an order of your choice. The operative is treated as performing the **Reposition** action (spend the AP accordingly), then continue its activation as normal. It’s obscured until the end of the next activation or the end of the turning point (whichever comes first). Less than half of your operatives can be set up above by the end of the first turning point. In other words, by the end of the first turning point, more than half of your operatives must have been set up in the killzone during the battle. When readying your operatives during the second and third turning points, remove one of your Drop markers. This means operatives still set up above are incapacitated at the end of the second turning point.

rules.name: GRAV-CHUTE
rules.description: Whenever a friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON operative is dropping, ignore the vertical distance.
rules.rules: Whenever a friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON operative is dropping, ignore the vertical distance.

name: VESPID STINGWINGS
description: Vespid Stingwings are an offensive kill team of highly agile xenos, characterised by their swarm-like instinctual behaviours. Guided by their Strain Leader and T'au handlers, they leverage advanced neutron weaponry and incredible flight capabilities to overwhelm enemies with devastating point-blank energy blasts and vicious melee attacks.

selection.operatives: ↘ 1 VESPID STINGWING STRAIN LEADER operative ↘ 1 VESPID STINGWING OVERSIGHT DRONE operative ↘ 9 VESPID STINGWING operatives selected from the following list: • LONGSTING • SHADESTRAIN • SKYBLAST • SWARMGUARD • WARRIOR Other than WARRIOR operatives, your kill team can only include each operative on this list once.

operatives.name: STRAIN LEADER
operatives.description: It is the task of the Strain Leader to interpret the commands of their kill team’s handler and then ensure their operatives comply.
operatives.keywords: VESPID STINGWING, T’AU EMPIRE, Strain, Leader

abilities.name: Communion Helm
abilities.rules: Once during each of this operative’s activations, you can spend 1 Communion point for free.

abilities.name: Commune
abilities.rules: When selecting your operatives for the battle, also select one VESPID STINGWING strategy ploy. Whenever this operative is in the killzone and isn’t within control range of enemy operatives, that ploy costs you 0CP.

abilities.name: Communion Helm
abilities.rules: Once during each of this operative's activations, you can spend 1 Communion point for free.

abilities.name: Commune
abilities.rules: When selecting your operatives for the battle, also select one VESPID STINGWING strategy ploy. Whenever this operative is in the killzone and not within control range of an enemy operative, that ploy costs you 0CP.

operatives.name: OVERSIGHT DRONE
operatives.description: The MV44 Oversight Drone is an adaptation of aerial reconnaissance units, providing invaluable tactical intelligence.
operatives.keywords: VESPID STINGWING, T’AU EMPIRE, Oversight, Drone

abilities.name: Drone
abilities.rules: This operative cannot perform any actions other than **Charge**, **Dash**, **Fall Back**, **Fight**, **Reposition**. It cannot use any weapons that aren’t on its datacard. Whenever determining control of an objective marker, treat this operative’s APL stat as 1 lower. Note this isn’t a change to its APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this. Whenever determining what’s visible to this operative, the round disc at the top of the miniature is its head.

abilities.name: Evasive Drone
abilities.rules:
• This operative cannot perform any action other than **Aerial Guidance**, **Charge**, **Dash**, **Fall Back**, **Fight** and **Reposition**.
• Whenever determining control of objective markers, treat this operative's APL stat as 1 lower.
• Whenever determining what's visible to this operative, the round disc at the top of the miniature is its head.
• Whenever this operative has a Conceal order and is in cover, it cannot be selected as a valid target, taking precedence over all other rules (e.g. Seek, Vantage terrain) except being within 2".
• Whenever an operative is shooting this operative, ignore the **Piercing** weapon rule.

operatives.name: LONGSTING
operatives.description: Vespid Longstings wield potent neutron rail rifles, capable of atom-stripping energy charges.
operatives.keywords: VESPID STINGWING, T’AU EMPIRE, Longsting

abilities.name: Neutron Fragment•
abilities.rules: If the target of this weapon isn’t incapacitated but you resolve any attack dice, the target gains one of your Neutron Fragment tokens. Whenever an operative that has one of your Neutron Fragment tokens is activated, inflict D3 damage on it for each Neutron Fragment token it has (roll separately for each).

operatives.name: SHADESTRAIN
operatives.description: Vespid Shadestrains are masters of flame, capable of unleashing torrents of fire to incinerate their foes.
operatives.keywords: VESPID STINGWING, T’AU EMPIRE, Shadestrain

abilities.name: Skytorch•
abilities.rules: An operative can only use this weapon during the Skytorch Assault action (see other side of card). If it does, don’t select a valid target. Instead, shoot against each operative within its torch zone (excluding operatives wholly underneath Vantage terrain); they aren’t in cover or obscured. Roll each sequence separately in order of furthest operative to closest. The torch zone is the horizontal area between the operative’s current and previous location. A 28mm round Skytorch marker can be temporarily placed underneath this operative before it moves to help determine this. **Torrent** 0" means you cannot select secondary targets outside of its torch zone, but this weapon still has the **Torrent** weapon rule for all other rules purposes, e.g. the Condensed Stronghold rule (see Killzone: Volkus, Kill Team Core Book).

abilities.name: Ghost Rig
abilities.rules: While this operative has a Conceal order, your opponent cannot select it as a valid target unless it's within 6" of the operative trying to target it. Note that this rule has no effect if this operative is not selected as the valid target, e.g. if it's a secondary target from the **Blast** weapon rule.

abilities.name: Camouflaged
abilities.rules: Whenever an operative is shooting this operative, ignore the **Piercing** weapon rule and all cover saves are retained as critical successes. This rule has no effect if this operative is not selected as the valid target, e.g. if it's a secondary target from the **Blast** weapon rule.

operatives.name: SWARMGUARD
operatives.description: Vespid Swarmguards provide focused neutron blaster fire, adapting to battlefield conditions with their instincts.
operatives.keywords: VESPID STINGWING, T’AU EMPIRE, Swarmguard

abilities.name: Warrior Instincts
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is shooting, if you don’t spend Communion points during that sequence, its neutron blaster has the **Accurate** 1 weapon rule until the end of that sequence.

operatives.name: WARRIOR
operatives.description: The bulk of most Mal’kor kill teams is comprised of Warriors. Resilient, swift and strong, they are natural combatants.
operatives.keywords: VESPID STINGWING, T’AU EMPIRE, Warrior

operatives.name: SHAS’UI PATHFINDER
operatives.description: Shas’ui Pathfinders are veteran warriors who have fought in many campaigns. They have passed dangerous trials of fire to reach the rank, and are dynamic and accomplished tacticians more than capable of leading their team to victory.
operatives.keywords: PATHFINDER, T'AU EMPIRE, Leader, Shas’ui

abilities.name: Veteran
abilities.rules: During a turning point in which you have used a friendly SHAS’UI operative’s Art of War **STRATEGIC GAMBIT** and you selected Mont’ka, this operative can use Kauyon instead during its activation (and vice versa).

operatives.name: ASSAULT GRENADIER PATHFINDER
operatives.description: Assault Grenadier Pathfinders are specialist reconnaissance infantry.
operatives.keywords: PATHFINDER, T'AU EMPIRE, Assault Grenadier

abilities.name: Grenadier Specialist
abilities.rules: This operative can use frag and krak grenades (see universal equipment). Doing so doesn’t count towards any **Limited** uses you have (i.e. if you also select those grenades from equipment for other operatives). Whenever it’s doing so, improve the Hit stat of that weapon by 1.

abilities.name: Grenadier Specialist
abilities.rules: This operative can use frag and krak grenades (see universal equipment). Doing so doesn’t count towards any limited uses you have (i.e. if you also select those grenades from equipment for other operatives). Whenever it’s doing so, improve the Hit stat of that weapon by 1.

actions.name: SIGNAL
actions.rules: **SUPPORT**. Select one other friendly PATHFINDER operative visible to and within 6" of this operative. Until the end of that operative’s next activation, add 1 to its APL stat. This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

operatives.name: BLOODED PATHFINDER
operatives.description: Many experienced and respected Pathfinders earn the personal name of Mont’yr, which translates as ‘Blooded’. Many bear highly advanced bionics in place of lost limbs, and are entrusted with specialist technology such as suppressed weapons. Note: Specific weapons, abilities, and actions for this operative are not detailed in the provided source excerpts beyond its basic stats.
operatives.keywords: PATHFINDER, T'AU EMPIRE, Blooded

abilities.name: Veteran
abilities.rules: During a turning point in which you have used a friendly **SHAS’UI** operative’s Art of War **STRATEGIC GAMBIT** and you selected Mont’ka, this operative can use Kauyon instead during its activation (and vice versa).

operatives.name: COMMS SPECIALIST PATHFINDER
operatives.description: Comms Specialist Pathfinders are part of Pathfinder kill teams.
operatives.keywords: PATHFINDER, T'AU EMPIRE, Comms Specialist

actions.name: SIGNAL
actions.rules: **SUPPORT**. Select one other friendly PATHFINDER operative visible to and within 6" of this operative. Until the end of that operative’s next activation, add 1 to its APL stat. This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

operatives.name: DRONE CONTROLLER PATHFINDER
operatives.description: Drone Controllers are part of Pathfinder kill teams.
operatives.keywords: PATHFINDER, T'AU EMPIRE, Drone Controller

abilities.name: Drone Controller
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is in the killzone: • Add 2" to the Move stat of friendly PATHFINDER DRONE operatives. • The Saviour Protocols firefight ploy costs you 0CP.

actions.name: Remote Pilot (1 AP)
effects: • One friendly PATHFINDER DRONE operative can immediately perform one free action, but it cannot move more than 2" during that action. That action can be one that’s normally restricted by its drone rule (this takes precedence over that rule).
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative. This operative can perform this action more than once during its activation, but if it does, the same DRONE operative cannot perform the same free action more than once per activation.

operatives.name: MARKSMAN PATHFINDER
operatives.description: Marksman Pathfinders carry customised rail rifles with advanced optics and sophisticated inertial dampeners to ensure incredible accuracy. These Pathfinders are also issued with experimental dart ammunition that is all but inaudible to the foe when fired.
operatives.keywords: PATHFINDER, T'AU EMPIRE, Marksman

abilities.name: Inertial Dampener
abilities.rules: You can ignore any changes to the Hit stat of this operative’s marksman rail rifle.

abilities.name: Inertial Dampener
abilities.rules: You can ignore any changes to the Hit stat of this operative’s marksman rail rifle.

operatives.name: MEDICAL TECHNICIAN PATHFINDER
operatives.description: In a Pathfinder kill team, the lives of the T’au are often in the hands of a Medical Technician. These selfless healers brave storms of enemy fire to reach the wounded.
operatives.keywords: PATHFINDER, T'AU EMPIRE, Medical Technician

abilities.name: Medic!
abilities.rules: The first time during each turning point that another friendly PATHFINDER operative (excluding DRONE) would be incapacitated while visible to and within 3" of this operative, you can use this rule, providing neither this nor that operative is within control range of an enemy operative. If you do, that friendly operative isn’t incapacitated, has 1 wound remaining and cannot be incapacitated for the remainder of the action. After that action, that friendly operative can immediately perform a free **Dash** action, but must end that move within this operative’s control range. Subtract 1 from this and that operative’s APL stats until the end of their next activations respectively, and if this rule was used during that friendly operative’s activation, that activation ends. You cannot use this rule if this operative is incapacitated, or if it’s a **Shoot** action and this operative would be a primary or secondary target.

abilities.name: Medic!
abilities.rules: The first time during each turning point that another friendly PATHFINDER operative (excluding **DRONE**) would be incapacitated while visible to and within 3" of this operative, you can use this rule, providing neither this nor that operative is within control range of an enemy operative. If you do, that friendly operative isn’t incapacitated and has 1 wound remaining and cannot be incapacitated for the remainder of the action. After that action, that friendly operative can immediately perform a free **Dash** action, but must end that move within this operative’s control range. Subtract 1 from this and that operative’s APL stats until the end of their next activations respectively, and if this rule was used during that friendly operative’s activation, that activation ends. You cannot use this rule if this operative is incapacitated, or if it's a **Shoot** action and this operative would be a primary or secondary target.

actions.name: MEDIKIT
actions.rules: Select one friendly PATHFINDER operative (excluding DRONE) within this operative’s control range to regain up to 2D3 lost wounds. It cannot be an operative that the Medic! rule was used on during this turning point. This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

actions.name: Medikit (1 AP)
effects: • Select one friendly PATHFINDER operative (excluding **DRONE**) within this operative’s control range to regain up to 2D3 lost wounds. It cannot be an operative that the Medic! rule was used on during this turning point.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

operatives.name: SHAS’LA PATHFINDER
operatives.description: Even the rank-and-file of Pathfinder teams are selfless adherents to the Greater Good, eagerly volunteering themselves for the most dangerous missions. They operate close to the enemy to learn all they can of them, as well as engaging them when necessary.
operatives.keywords: PATHFINDER, T'AU EMPIRE, Shas’la

abilities.name: Group Activation
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is expended, you must then activate one other ready friendly PATHFINDER SHAS’LA operative (if able) before your opponent activates. When that other operative is expended, your opponent then activates as normal (in other words, you cannot activate more than two operatives in succession with this rule).

abilities.name: Fearless on the Frontline
abilities.rules: This operative can perform the Markerlight action while within control range of an enemy operative (taking precedence over the Markerlight action’s normal conditions). In addition, this operative can perform the Fall Back action for 1 less AP

abilities.name: Group Activation
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is expended, you must then activate one other ready friendly PATHFINDER SHAS’LA operative (if able) before your opponent activates. When that other operative is expended, your opponent then activates as normal (in other words, you cannot activate more than two operatives in succession with this rule).

operatives.name: TRANSPECTRAL INTERFERENCE PATHFINDER
operatives.description: Transpectral Interference Pathfinders are part of Pathfinder kill teams.
operatives.keywords: PATHFINDER, T'AU EMPIRE, Transpectral Interference

actions.name: MULTI-DIMENSIONAL VISION
actions.rules: Until the start of this operative’s next activation, whenever it’s shooting, enemy operatives cannot be obscured. This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

actions.name: SYSTEM JAM
actions.rules: Select one enemy operative visible to this operative. Until the end of that operative’s next activation, subtract 1 from its APL stat. This operative cannot perform this action while it has a Conceal order, or while within control range of an enemy operative.

actions.name: Multi-Dimensional Vision (1 AP)
effects: • Until the start of this operative’s next activation, whenever it’s shooting, enemy operatives cannot be obscured.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

actions.name: System Jam (1 AP)
effects: • Select one enemy operative visible to this operative. Until the end of that operative’s next activation, subtract 1 from its APL stat.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

operatives.name: WEAPONS EXPERT PATHFINDER
operatives.description: Weapons Experts Pathfinders wield their kill team’s heavy weapons. Their task is a relatively simple one – to kill or destroy what their Shas’ui orders them to or what they deem to be an important target.
operatives.keywords: PATHFINDER, T'AU EMPIRE, Weapons Expert

operatives.name: MV1 GUN DRONE
operatives.description: Using anti-gravitic motors and jet-thrusters, Gun Drones hover over the landscape, moving quickly to engage the enemy and record battlefield data. On kill team missions they can distract enemies while the Pathfinders carry out their tasks as well as partake in attacks alongside the T’au warriors they serve.
operatives.keywords: PATHFINDER, T'AU EMPIRE, MV1 Gun, Drone

abilities.name: Drone
abilities.rules:
• This operative cannot perform any actions other than **Charge**, **Dash**, **Fall Back**, **Fight**, **Reposition** and **Shoot**. It cannot use any weapons that aren’t on its datacard.
• Whenever determining control of an objective marker, treat this operative’s APL stat as 1 lower. Note this isn’t a change to its APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this.
• Whenever determining what’s visible to this operative, the round disc at the top of the miniature is its head.

operatives.name: MB3 RECON DRONE
operatives.description: These large drones are capable of collecting swathes of vital battlefield data that can make the difference between victory and defeat. Being larger, they can also be mounted with heavier weaponry.
operatives.keywords: PATHFINDER, T'AU EMPIRE, MB3 Recon, Drone

abilities.name: Drone

• This operative cannot perform any actions other than **Charge**, **Dash**, **Fall Back**, **Fight**, Markerlight, **Reposition** and **Shoot**. It cannot use any weapons that aren’t on its datacard.
• Whenever determining control of an objective marker, treat this operative’s APL stat as 1 lower. Note this isn’t a change to its APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this.

abilities.name: Analyse
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative performs the Markerlight action, each other enemy operative that’s both visible to this operative and within 3" of the enemy operative you selected for that action also gains one of your Markerlight tokens.

abilities.rules: Whenever this operative performs the Markerlight action, each other enemy operative that’s both visible to this operative and within 3" of the enemy operative you selected for that action also gains one of your Markerlight tokens.

operatives.name: MV31 PULSE ACCELERATOR DRONE
operatives.description: Pulse Accelerator Drones boost the pulse weapons carried by Pathfinders, making the technology much more powerful and giving them a vital edge against the enemy.
operatives.keywords: PATHFINDER, T'AU EMPIRE, MV31 Pulse Accelerator, Drone

abilities.name: Drone
abilities.rules:
• This operative cannot perform any actions other than **Charge**, **Dash**, **Fall Back**, **Fight**, **Pulse Accelerator** and **Reposition**. It cannot use any weapons that aren’t on its datacard.
• Whenever determining control of an objective marker, treat this operative’s APL stat as 1 lower. Note this isn’t a change to its APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this.
• Whenever determining what’s visible to this operative, the round disc at the top of the miniature is its head.

operatives.name: MV33 GRAV-INHIBITOR DRONE
operatives.description: Grav-inhibitor Drones are capable of manipulating gravity around and significantly slow the progress of oncoming enemy troops. On countless occasions have Pathfinder kill teams escaped almost certain death thanks to the technology carried by these drones.
operatives.keywords: PATHFINDER, T'AU EMPIRE, MV33 Grav-inhibitor, Drone

abilities.rules: Whenever an enemy operative is within 6" of this operative, subtract 2" from that enemy operative’s Move stat.

abilities.name: Grav-inhibiter
abilities.rules:
• Whenever an enemy operative performs an action in which it moves, if it would move visible to and within 6" of this operative, subtract 2" from the total distance it can move during that action (to a minimum of 2"). Note this isn’t a change to the Move stat.
• Whenever an enemy operative is fighting or retaliating while visible to and within 6" of this operative, worsen the Hit stat of that enemy operative’s melee weapons by 1. This is cumulative with being injured.

operatives.name: MV4 SHIELD DRONE
operatives.description: Shield Drones are fitted with shield generators rather than weaponry. It is their task to protect the Pathfinders they accompany. Their saviour protocols ensure that should a T’au come under direct threat, the Shield Drone will move with remarkable speed to protect them from harm.
operatives.keywords: PATHFINDER, T'AU EMPIRE, MV4 Shield, Drone

• Once per turning point, when an attack dice inflicts **Normal Dmg** on this operative, you can ignore that inflicted damage.
• You can use the Saviour Protocols firefight ploy for 0CP if this is the specified DRONE operative.

operatives.name: MV7 MARKER DRONE
operatives.description: The high-intensity markerlights used by Marker Drones are vital for the synergy of T’au forces. They indicate priority targets both for the Pathfinders they are alongside as well as other powerful T’au assets. Whatever they pick out will soon be obliterated by overwhelming firepower. Note: Base stats and weapons for this operative are not fully detailed in the provided source excerpts; stats are inferred from similar drones.
operatives.keywords: PATHFINDER, T'AU EMPIRE, MV7 Marker, Drone

abilities.name: High-intensity Markerlight
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative performs the Markerlight action, the selected enemy operative gains two of your Markerlight tokens (instead of one).
